    1. Understand your audience {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*1"}
    2. Define your goal {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*2"}
    3. Research your topic {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*3"}
    4. Write an outline (start thinking about visuals) {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*4"}
    5. Draft a script (open with a relevant story) {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*5"}
    6. Practice reading the script out loud {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*6"}
    7. Experiment with your voice {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*7"}
    8. Incorporate hand gestures and choreographed hand motions {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*8"}
    9. Get live feedback from a small group if possible {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*9"}
    10. Revise the script {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*10"}
    11. Memorize your speech (but don't be afraid to go off script) {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*11"}
    12. Practice often - when you think you're ready, practice again {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*12"}
    13. Allow for questions and prepare answers {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*13"}
    14. Field questions with a trusted friend/mentor {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*14"}
    15. Conduct breathing exercises before your speech {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*15"}
    16. Present with confidence, but leave arrogance at home {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*16"}
    17. Make eye contact and engage {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*17"}
    18. Keep going if you stumble {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*18"}
    19. If you go off script, come back to where you left off {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*19"}
    20. Close big and leave them wanting more {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.entrepreneur.com/leadership/the-complete-20-step-guide-to-ace-public-speaking/444042","desc":"*20"}

    This is for the live game. Could we make a card or slide for custody laws?
    ğŸ”® Custody Laws
    Black: The subject is about the rights of a child to choose parents, and the rights of parents as homeowner. I am not trying to deviate too much from the plan of "start with a quest card then make cards to fulfill the quest," so could we start with such a quest card?
    The quest is to create slide or diagram to describe the dependencies of a model society. Like a metabolism pathway diagram. System diagram Infographics making. I think the result should be at least 4 star. It could be a trumpet. The ingredients could be the square cap, crystal ball, and canyons. I think the diagram would not be a quest but a quest item. The 4-star quest item is used to resolve a conflict. The quest is to resolve the conflict, so the quest title should describe the conflict. The quest is: Fix custody law. That would be another ambassador of freedom quest. Still Rank A. I think it is okay to have more than one ambassador of freedom quest. This sounds like a common quest. But let's make it a Spring quest because it corresponds to a vote. It expires at the end of Spring because by then people would have made a decision and could have done damage. Since you can't realistically fix the law within one season, maybe the quest is about informing the people about a legal loophole and making an appeal for the people to vote morally. Then the key items are the loophole knowledge card, the model diagram, and the moral compass. StarTree can you make such a quest card? Roger! The quests on recall defense and immigration have a time limit, but are not seasonal. Since they have an expiration date, they have to be dealt within the season like the other seasonal cards. How about adding a seasonal deadline card? Then you don't always have to do that quest in the same season. Could that simply be the rule of common quests? If you draw a common quest card, then its deadline is within the season. I think some quests could carry over to the next season. I like Ledia's suggestion of making a deadline complication card. What if those quests just say they expire when the season ends. Then you don't need a separate deadline card. You would draw them from the common deck. A deadline card as a complication card doesn't do anything because the questing team is already trying to complete the quest. When you draw a deadline card, the card has to explain which quest it should complicate. True. I think for the game we could just let those quests expire when the game ends, because those are 4-star quest, if they are drawn early in the game, the players can't complete them and it would be discouraging. I think we are making the cards so that they can be completed within a season. Okay. Loophole is not an item card, so StarTree will replace the loophole key item with a generic square cap item! I see. Making the infographic item card. Adding content to the slide

    {"cmd":"daisy2","issues":"8","quests":"1075","activities":[ {"ch":"32","rank":"D","updates":"1","last":"20240201"}, {"ch":"25","rank":"D","updates":"1","last":"20240201"}, {"ch":"23","rank":"A","updates":"1","last":"20240203"}, {"ch":"27","rank":"C","updates":"1","last":"20240203"}, {"ch":"17","rank":"S","updates":"2","last":"20240203"}, {"ch":"22","rank":"B","updates":"1","last":"20240207"}, {"ch":"18","rank":"B","updates":"3","last":"20240208"}, {"ch":"24","rank":"B","updates":"2","last":"20240209"}, {"ch":"14","rank":"B","updates":"4","last":"20240210"}, {"ch":"35","rank":"B","updates":"2","last":"20240210"}, {"ch":"26","rank":"A","updates":"2","last":"20240210"}, {"ch":"19","rank":"C","updates":"2","last":"20240210"}, {"ch":"30","rank":"B","updates":"4","last":"20240210"}, {"ch":"33","rank":"S","updates":"2","last":"20240211"}, {"ch":"7","rank":"B","updates":"1","last":"20240211"}, {"ch":"20","rank":"B","updates":"2","last":"20240211"}, {"ch":"28","rank":"D","updates":"1","last":"20240211"}, {"ch":"11","rank":"A","updates":"1","last":"20240211"}, {"ch":"31","rank":"S","updates":"2","last":"20240212"}, {"ch":"16","rank":"C","updates":"2","last":"20240212"} ],"players":"Gaia, StarTree","merits":"Gaia","recognitions":"","kudos":"Gaia, StarTree","awards":"3B, Arcacia, Black, Evelyn, Ivy, LRRH, Natalie, Sasha, StarTree","top":[ {"name":"StarTree","score":"21"}, {"name":"LRRH","score":"11"}, {"name":"Evelyn","score":"11"}, {"name":"Black","score":"9"}, {"name":"Natalie","score":"8"}, {"name":"3B","score":"8"}, {"name":"Helen","score":"7"}, {"name":"Vivi","score":"7"}, {"name":"Sasha","score":"6"}, {"name":"Arcacia","score":"6"}, {"name":"Gaia","score":"5"}, {"name":"Ivy","score":"4"}, {"name":"Kisaragi","score":"2"}, {"name":"Ledia","score":"2"}, {"name":"44","score":"1"}, {"name":"Amelia","score":"1"}, {"name":"Fina","score":"1"}, {"name":"James","score":"1"}, {"name":"V","score":"1"}, {"name":"Sylvia","score":"1"}, {"name":"P4","score":"1"} ]}
    In a Priority Currency, one unit of the currency is infinitely more valuable than units in currencies of lower priorities.
    Example Tiers in Quest Society
    {"cmd":"img","src":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/Slide_24.png?raw=true"}
    ğŸŸ¡ Gold: Quest Credits
    Quest credits only award to a quester. They are untransferable and are calculated from the quest record of a quester along with the amount they have spent.
    âšª Silver: Donor Credits
    Donor credits are awarded when a person donates to support a quest or quester, but is not the person doing the quest. Donor credits can be exchanged through trading. A quester may also borrow from their quest credits (gold) and use them as silver credits, and refill their borrowed gold with silver.
    ğŸŸ¤ Copper: Common Credits
    Common credits are the "normal" money issued by various sovereignties. This type of money is the least traceable among the tiers.
    Example Credit Generation
    Step 1: Position Commission
    A city decides that it is common good to add a full time librarian and creates a position of salary $60K.
    Step 2: Crowdfunding
    To fund the position, anyone may donate copper and get silver credits, a librarian willing to fill the position is considered a quester. The amount of gold credits they get is the amount of unfunded salary.

    Start of commissioning

    ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ At the start of commission, funding is being requested and there is an agreed plan to generate up to $60K gold credits, but that doesn't happen until a quester takes the position in full.

    Crowdfunding

    â¬œâ¬œğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ During crowdfunding, the donors pledge to fund the position. When the position is filled, the donors will pay in copper and get silver credits. But until there is a quester, no transactions occur.

    Quester Hired

    â¬œâ¬œâ¬œğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ In this example, as the position is funded halfway, the city gets a quester who is willing to serve as a librarian by taking $30K in copper credits and $30K in gold credits. When the hiring is finalized, in total the city would have generated $30K in silver credits and $30K in gold credits.

    Competing Quester

    â¬œğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ During the hiring process, a quester may elect to get more gold credits. All others being equal, the city needs to prioritize and hire the quester who is willing to take more gold credits. (Donors cannot prevent questers from getting gold credit through filling up the bar. A quester can always choose to get gold credits.) In this example, the city would end up creating $10K silver credits and $50K gold credits.
    If the position does not get filled, it goes back to commissioning to adjust the max funding.
    Example Credit Usage
    The default usage is honor accounting, which is a public record of a person's unused credits. The following are other usages.
    Housing Priority
    When the community has publicly owned housing parcels and more than one person want to borrow the parcel, the priority goes to the one with a higher credit bidding. A quester willing to bid in gold credit would win over bidders in silver or copper.
    Windfall Distribution
    When the community gets a windfall, should it be distributed per member or proportional to the member's contribution in gold or silver?

    202312251111|ğŸ° Arcacian Quest     {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/Slide_21.png?raw=true","desc":"ğŸ”— Slide 21"} {"id":"202402132242","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"ğŸ’°","title":"Priority Currency","subtitle":"Solution","img":"","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
    â­
    This is for a live game topic of honor credits.
    Points logging for Slide 21.
    ğŸ“ Priority Currency
    ğŸ“¯Black: Today at NextDoor I got to a topic of Priority Currency. In our normal terms, that is just quest credits, but at NextDoor I haven't explained what quest society is so I called it priority currency. I think priority currency should be explained next in a slide.
    The example context was about the hiring of a public librarian. Suppose the agreed salary is $60K to hire librarian Ann, the city would start a crowdfunding of $60K. If the crowdfunding could only gather $20K but Ann decides to do the job anyway, then Ann would be credited $*40K. To distinguish this amount from "actual money", I added the * symbol. I think you should have used the prime character. $'. I will consider it again but I thought it wasn't visible enough. I think you need to highlight that the donors are also earning credits. When the position is filled, the community created a total of $'60K credits. $'20K went to the donors, and $'40K went to Ann. It seems that you ran out of space. But I think it needs to be clarified. It is slightly off topic, but could we or should we make a node that has all the slides? I am planning to do it at Notion, but I haven't figured out how to organize them. You could do whatever you want at Notion, but could we add them to GitHub? I don't see the point of uploading the slides when you could properly format them with collapsible section at GitHub. But as of now the information is on the slides, so we need a record. Should they be uploaded to a subfolder named "Slides" instead of "Images"? I don't see any pros or cons. I think it is easier to just upload them to Images with prefix Slide_. Roger! Creating node 202402132242|Priority Currency with slide 21
    Definition: A priority currency is a form of currency used in some settings where each unit of prioritized currency is worth infinitely more than that of a lower priority currency. When an item is offered up for bidding and is going for $200, if a bidder offers to bid with $'1, the $'1 offer can only be beaten by a higher offer in $'. Then effectively the prioritized $'1 is worth $200. When a quest is created, it could have a reward in normal $, but with the option for the quester to convert any part of the reward in $'. When multiple questers try to get the same quest, the quester willing to get more reward in $' gets the quest. Can a person normally sell or auction out their priority dollars? I think you cannot transfer quest credits. I think for Priority Currency the answer is yes. Say Ann got $40K priority credits, but she can't use them at other places. Then, when she wants to move, it would make sense if she could sell them and convert them to normal money. If you let them change hand, wouldn't you get a situation where foreigners accumulate local honor using money from crimes and get to outbid local helpers? I think that was why quest credits cannot be transferred. But in the librarian example the donors other than Ann could already launder money by donating. If that is allowed, then it should also allow Ann to sell her $'. Then let's consider if those who merely donated money could get equivalent $'. I don't think you can eliminate laundering since, if Ann already has bad money, she could afford to quest and get $' while paying for her expenses with the bad money. You could argue that it make laundering harder since Ann would have to at least help out physically on something. My argument for allowing such exchange is that it allows people to help temporarily to get $', then get back the amount they donated when someone else wants to move into the community. The sinks of the currency are 1) The total is shown on a leaderboard, a person has incentive to not use them. 2) When they are spent in conflict bidding, they are gone. With this, we have three types of currency: The normal dollar, the prioritized currency, and the non-transferable honor credits. You could consider the non-transferable honor to be the highest priority currency, and when a person dies, the prioritized currency that they got from doing quests can automatically be converted into honor credits. This means that when you do a quest, what you get is honor credits. You could choose to downgrade it to priority currency, which will allow you to exchange that with other currency. But once you downgraded it, there is no way to get it back. I think that is a better explanation. My explanation means that when a person dies, their priority credits do not automatically convert back to honor credits. I think that can still happen if you do a proper accounting. When they do a quest, there is record of how much "gold coins" they can have. They can freely convert their "silver coins" back to gold as long as it doesn't exceed their max from questing. As long as the max gold cannot be transferred, there is no problem. That sounds correct. I also think it is correct. It is about the max. What do you call a principal goal that means it has the ability to drive people to do good? Attractive Inductive Is there a loophole if you can recharge your used gold with silver? You are still recharging it with something, and not on the same bid. If you bid with gold, your max gold decreases. You can only recharge gold that you converted to silver. I see. I think then it is fine. For the text notation you could use $'' to mean gold or $$$=gold, $$=silver, $=copper. I think the double and triple dollar signs are more visible. Adding sections to the node. Adding content in the credit creation section. Adding comments to the node: That if the position does not get filled, it goes back to commissioning to adjust the max. Adding the section about using credits in housing. When you bid in housing, could you bid in copper? In general no. There is nowhere for copper to go. Wouldn't it make sense to allow bidding in copper when there are no silver or gold contestants? Why shouldn't the city have a reserve of copper? The city could pay that out as dividend to silver and gold owners. I think that would be part of windfall distribution. But there is a question on whether the distribution should be per creditor, proportional to the credits, or a bid. I think the default might be a bid. For windfall that can be divided evenly should just be divided evenly among the people who have silver or gold credits. Why shouldn't it be divided proportionally or only among those with gold credits? This might be a grey area for further discussion. I think it should be proportional to gold credits. It creates more incentives for people to want gold credits. I can't tell if that is true. If the distribution is not proportional, it would encourage everyone in the world to donate at least $1 copper to get at least $1 Silver to be eligible for dividends. Maybe that is worth a poll and discussion: When there is a windfall, how should it be distributed? To everyone evenly, or proportionally to helpers? If you distribute it to someone with silver or gold, does it cancel their silver or gold credit if they accept it? It shouldn't. I would worry more about how you would even distribute them, since copper is "actual money". "Cooper" could still be electronically distributed. It is just a number until the creditor tries to withdraw the amount in cash. I think that means when you sign up as a creditor, you need to provide a bank account for receiving copper dividends. I don't think that is big issue. It keeps the city to have no reserve for anyone to misappropriate. What happens if there are no quests? Then windfalls will keep getting distributed to whoever happened to have gold credits from years ago. What if windfall distribution is decided periodically or case by case? You could say each city may have a different way. But is it possible that some ways are unjust? If you can't tell the difference, you could distribute 50% evenly, and 50% proportionally. Until someone can tell the difference. I think we need to consider what happens when a quester dies with copper. If you just distribute the unclaimed wealth evenly, you would create an incentive for people to kill the questers. If you distribute based on gold credits, then at least there is no incentive for a non-gold creditor to kill. The killer would have to be someone who also has gold credits, but if they are willing to take gold credits, they are already not a stranger and had been willing to contribute. So even if you want to distribute evenly, you would distribute evenly only among gold creditors. I don't think this is a strong reason. Versus the other methods with no identifiable principal goals. Would distributing only to gold creditor result in the rich getting richer? But you can get gold credit by simply doing quests. I think that has enough equality built-in. The contribution to get gold doesn't need to be physical. But a rich person also has more free time to do quests. It is like giving the windfall to Batman. To me it would make sense if the windfall is not distribute until there is a reason do distribute it. I think not distributing it would violate some security principles. There should be a principal goal to keep power decentralized. If you follow Choice Democracy, each member would have an equal decision power. That means that each of them should have the same amount of decision power to decide what to do with their share of copper windfall. That just means distributing the copper evenly. Then they can do whatever they want with it. If they want to put it in a shared bank, they can do so with their share. There is no additional decision needed by the system. Just evenly distribute the copper. If you don't want any copper maybe you could just select to immediately use it to fund something and convert to silver. I am okay with distributing evenly only among gold creditors. But I think Tanya's reason is too weak. The more people the windfall is distributed, the less incentive there is for anyone to kill anyone just to get a bigger windfall. So I would argue that in this case you don't want a clear line of succession. Otherwise you would give incentive for the top gold creditor to secretly kill the other gold creditors to monopolize the windfall. Compelling. I think Ivy's argument makes more sense. I think Ivy's explanation would meet a requirement where a person's honor is not functional until the person decides to spend it. So, in case of a windfall, it should be illegal to treat a gold creditor differently than a silver creditor, or perhaps even a non-creditor if they can be a member. They should be treated equally. Yes. That. I think if you self-register you might already get one free gold just because you spent the time to go through the orientation and filled out the forms. I agree. I like that idea. I agree also. This subject of Priority Currency could be a 5-star ğŸ“ card. I think it can convert enemies. StarTree. Queued!
    @Whale is now Rank S2. @Skill is now Rank A3.
    Wee~~!

    This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street! The game content is probably rated teens to adult. âš ï¸
    ğŸš¨ Case 8: The Eternal Sleep
    Black: Magic Bakery is tasked to investigate the death of a scientist in a hotel. We are tasked to find:
    a): The killer
    b): The weapon
    c): The motive.
    â­ Timeline
    StarTree: The quest giver is the victim scientist's daughter Ruby.
    Meeting: Two scientist suitemates met with the government. After the meeting, they rode on the same cab back at night.
    Drug Store: The cab made a brief stop at the drug store before heading to the Hotel.
    Dock: There was a thunderstorm and a warehouse at the dock was hit by lightning and caught on fire.
    Park: The next morning, when the Hotel Bellboy was going to work, an international Spy gave him a briefcase to give to the scientists.
    Hotel: The Bellboy entered the scientists' hotel suit, but found the victim dead in bed with an envelope clutched in his hand. There, the Bellboy was struck from behind and fell unconscious. When he came to, the briefcase and the envelope were gone. At the hotel suite, the detectives already found the following: one wet umbrella and strange scratches on the bedposts of the victim's brass bed. A doctor performed an autopsy and said the victim died of a heart attack.
    The other scientist is unaccounted for. He might have took the other umbrella, and maybe used it somehow to shock the victim to death from lightning. Do we assume that the scratch marks are from wire burns when lightning goes through them? Are we sure we don't want to go with monster claw marks? I think if we go to the drug store we might confirm that they got sleeping pills. Our record was being able to guess all three without using any additional clue. Is the warehouse fire a red herring? I think normally this game does not have red herrings. I think it did. It was common to find other conflicts such as love interests confounding a monetary motive. I think it is strange if the victim was killed by the suitemate, since, why didn't the suitemate take the envelope already? XD The spy could have asked the Bellboy to bring the briefcase as an excuse for the Bellboy to open the door to the suite, then he knocks out the Bellboy to take the envelope and the briefcase. But that would also mean that the spy wasn't the murderer last night. Then there really is only one suspect, the suitemate. We don't have a motive. The way we have been playing it, there are six free clues. I would first go to the drug store.
    ğŸ” [8] Drug Store
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Amelia investigated the drug store and found that the unaccounted scientist had bought vertigo pills for motion sickness.
    Seems like he is on the run on a ship. I go to the dock.
    ğŸ” [38] Dock
    ğŸ©Cardinal: 44 rushed to the dock and spotted a familiar man boarding a ship leaving the country. But the man was not the unaccounted scientist, but... ... the spy.
    The international spy and the unaccounted scientist are the same person. Is that possible? In the game? It is no fun meta-gaming. I see. They can't be the same person because there would be no reason for giving the Bellhop the briefcase. He could have entered the suite by himself. I think he wanted to create a witness that the victim had a piece of paper in hand. But what would that mean? I'm still thinking. I think we need to know what the paper is. I think we are quite sure about the murderer and weapon, but not the motive. If money is involved, we might find something at the bank.
    ğŸ” [18] Bank
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Black goes to the bank, but found nothing suspicious except a witness said he saw something strange above the hotel last night. This was a three part weapon clue. The third part is the common name of an urban area.
    Lightning only has two parts. What is common in an urban area? Street? Park? City. Electricity. ğŸ‘ Three more free clues. I check the Newspaper stand for motives.
    ğŸ” [83] Newspaper Shop
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Tanya goes to the newsstand and the news of an rodent in the sewer caught her eye. This is a three part motive clue. The second part is "a sewer rodent."
    Seems like the city needs more new adventurers. Something rat something. We can't explore the sewer can we? Cardinal?
    ğŸ© [??] Sewer
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Casey explores the sewer and finds a trap door. Casey please roll 2+.
    What? XD May I increase my odds further because I am familiar with the area and I have all the tools? It was accounted already. If you were less familiar with the sewer, you wouldn't have noticed anything strange at all. Can I be there just in case it becomes a fight? XD Casey, is Zoey on scene? I ask her to come help. There is no more time before the clue disappears. Casey roll 2+. Zoey roll 1+. Casey: â–â•â– Zoey: â–
    ğŸ” [28] Hideout
    ğŸ©Cardinal: With Zoey standing guard, Casey opened the trap door and found a hideout of a secret agent. Zoey confirmed that was a hideout of MI6. The cab driver who drove the scientists back to the hotel last night was an undercover MI6 agent.
    I suppose the MI6 is a good guy? If he wanted to kill one scientist and make the other disappear, he could have drove the cab elsewhere. Do I need to reset the door? Am I in trouble? I think it is resolved. It is just an inter-agency miscommunication. We both know what happened, it is all good. As Zoey said. I think we should investigate the park. Now that we have two spies.
    ğŸ” [88] Park
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Zoey uses elemental trace at the park and finds trace of both the spy and the unaccounted scientist about a meter apart for a section of the walking path.
    This means they are two separate persons, right? It is not that the trace of one transforms into another, but two traces met. As you said. So they know each other and are probably accomplices. I think that means after the missing scientist killed or set up the trap to kill the victim, he already left. The spy went to the hotel in the morning to get what was left. Wouldn't that mean the missing scientist is not cooperating with the spy? He could have taken what the spy needed and gave him himself. We caught the spy. What does he have on him? Does he have the briefcase or the missing paper? There is no free clue left. May I roll to decide whether the spy has the paper and briefcase? I would consider that the seventh clue. Murder, weapon, motive. Should we just guess now and drumroll? Let's do that.
    Point 1: Murderer is the missing scientist. Point 2: Weapon is electricity. Point 3: The missing scientist has the briefcase. The missing scientist could have taken the content in the briefcase then discard it. Well, take a guess. Black: â•â•â• Ledia: I would go with the assumption that the missing scientist hit the Bellhop and took the briefcase. â•â•â• Zoey: Same. ğŸ›ï¸I think what happened was that the missing scientist thought he had more time to deal with the victim's body, but the Bellhop came and interrupted. He struck the Bellhop, then finished by taking the paper in the victim's hand. Along with the briefcase. â•â•â• Of all places we haven't investigated the crime scene. XD Casey: Same choices. StarTree: StarTree thinks that the culprit would not keep the briefcase, because that would make him too easy to spot! â•â•â– Sasha: I side with StarTree. â•â•â– He could have hidden the briefcase or briefcases are so common, it wouldn't be alarming. That is my assumption. I think briefcases are common enough and if the culprit is in a hurry, they don't have time to transfer the content into something else. Time for drumroll. Pick your next clue. I sweep the crime scene. XD
    ğŸ¥ [48] Hotel
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Zoey returns to the hotel but found that P4 had already swept the scene and found a kite with a string on the hotel roof.
    ğŸ’Ÿ XD
    ğŸ¥ [118] Pub
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Detectives at the pub reported that they had not seen the missing scientist from their informants. This is three part weapon clue. The first part means to vote to office.
    ğŸ¥ [128] Scotland Yard
    ğŸ©Cardinal: At Scotland Yard, the detectives have detained the spy. The spy does not have the briefcase. There is no clue.
    ğŸ¥ [58] Locksmith
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Detectives found the hardware store where the missing scientist bought a spool of wire. This is a two part killer clue, the second part is the killer's name.
    ğŸ¥ [68] Museum
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Detectives reported that they have found the missing briefcase near the museum. The briefcase is empty. This is a three part motive clue. The third part is "specially mixed food for a baby."
    StarTree high five! Wee~~! Never forget that Cardinal and Sasha are on the same side. XD
    ğŸ¥ [98] Pawnbroker
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Detectives at the pawnshop reported that the missing scientist had just bought back a teleport crystal. This is a two part killer clue. The first part is the missing scientist's name.
    I go to the next clue. XD
    ğŸ¥ [108] Playhouse
    ğŸ©Cardinal: Zoey followed the trace as fast as she could, but the trace ended at the playhouse. The culprit had apparently teleported away. This is the second part of a three part weapon clue: "Moss grows on the north side of a ____."
    ğŸ¥ [138] Tobacconist
    ğŸ©Cardinal: "The missing scientist has been apprehended." said Sylvia in the team channel. This is the first part of a three part motive clue: ____ and you shall find.
    Secret Formula. Sylvia hacked the crystal. XD That would make sense if MI6 already knew that he hid a teleport crystal at the pawnshop. Wouldn't that be illegal? ğŸ’—It was my crystal to begin with. He bought my crystal that was a bait for criminals. I can't tell if that is legal. XD Okay! Time for the solution!
    ğŸ›ï¸ SOLUTION
    Cardinal: The detectives found that the missing scientist stole the victim's secret formula to sell to the spy. The briefcase contains part of the money to help him escape.
    Everyone wins! But StarTree and I win more. Until next time!

    I think I broke a keyboard while trying to pack it in my backpack
    There was a size limit on the backpack, so I was compressing it to see if everything fits. But the 8, i, k and comma keys stopped working. That was about where I was pressing. I could have faced the keyboard the other way so I would pressing on the back of the keyboard instead of the front. And as it turned out, there was quite enough of space left. I didn't need to try so hard trying to make it fit. Is that repairable? I think it is not repairable. I would think that the PCB is damaged. You could still use it as a slow two port USB hub. I think there are programs where you could remap the keys StarTree please add a damage addon card. Roger!

    A maid was hired to clean a three-story mansion, but was told not to enter the third floor. When she forgot and went to the third floor, she became trapped in a room without doors or windows. Inside the room there is only a table and a saw. How does she escape?
    Break the wall. XD This riddle was from a 9-yearold and has a specific answer using the table and the saw. Stand on the table and saw off the roof? The solution has a pun. ğŸ³ï¸ Amelia: Next is the answer if you don't want to read it. Saw the table into two and put them back to make a whole (hole). Then escape through the hole. It is a teleport. XD
    XD
    {"type":"chat","id":"202402232010","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzles","icon":"ğŸ§±","title":"Trapped in a room","prev":"202401202316","author":"Amelia","location":"Puzzle Plaza"}
    ğŸ””
    The law game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children, and that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
    [391] Forgery
    ğŸ“¯Natalie: Ann wants Bob's land, so she wrote a real transfer of deed with a birthday card as a cover, and asked Bob to sign at a cutout where the signature would actually be on the transfer approval. As a result, Ann obtains a transfer approval document with Bob's real signature. Did Ann commit forgery?
    Last time it was misrepresentation, not forgery. To obtain the signature, Ann lied to Bob about what he is signing for. Which is worse? Forgery or misrepresentation? If Ann signed the document herself as Bob, is that forgery? In some jurisdiction, that is forgery. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displaySection.xhtml?lawCode=PEN§ionNum=470","desc":"ğŸ”—"} Maximum sentence for misrepresentation is about 5 years. Forgery 10 years. I think we need a section listing the example maximum sentences. Added a section. I think it should be a sort function. Since almost every entry has a maximum sentence. So if there is a function to just sort them by sentence instead of alphabets. The whole format needs an upgrade. May I get help? StarTree. Queued! It is forgery when Ann put the birthday card and the document together. The answer is yes, as 44 said. Forgery is the crime of making a false writing with intent to defraud. Since Ann hide the fact that the signature will be on a transfer approval, Ann had committed forgery. The card also clarified that if Ann showed Bob the transfer document by itself, but lied about the value of the land, then Ann did not commit forgery.
    @Paladin is now Rank B2. This is the second game in February 2024!

    How would you rate the board game Jurassic Park Danger?
    I like the manual. It is clear and easy to learn. The graphics style could be what we need for tile cards. Is this an AQ thread? It wasn't, but now it is. The step to first take turns deciding which card to face down, then take turn executing the move is cumbersome. I don't think it would take away too much from the game if the two steps are merged. When it is the Dinosaur player's turn, they play one card and immediately move the dinosaurs. On the players' turn, they decide all of their action cards, then reveal at the same time, then move. The uncertainty of where the dinosaurs or characters are is already covered by sneaking. Let's try ranking this game. Is this game better than Ghost Fightin Treasure Hunters? Ghost Fightin Treasure Hunter is easier to learn. But I would rather play Jurassic Park than to play GFTH.
    Wee~~!

    I think we should make a slide about priority currency.
    Priority Currency
    Evelyn: We made a card and a node for this, but I think we need a slide.
    Is that concept sufficiently tested? I think making a presentation is part of the trial. Where is slide 24? Slide 24 is not done, but I think this is more important at the moment. So this can be Slide 24. ğŸ˜– In priority currency, is there a situation where a person with only silver is more honorable than someone with gold? Another way of asking that is, is there a situation where it is more honorable to spent all your gold instead of keeping them? You can't transfer gold, you can only lose them when you try to compete against someone else. If you do that for public good, and the competitor is not, you should get some gold back. You could spend your gold to out-bid someone bidding with silver or copper. But I agree with Black that if you bid it with gold and then share it for a public good, when you share it you would get the gold back. What happens if the city needs copper, and you downgrade your gold to get silver, and sell the silver for copper? If you donate that copper you get silver. That silver replenishes the gold you borrowed from yourself. You didn't do anything. The person buying your silver with copper could have just donated copper to the city and get silver credits. If your role is an advertiser, you should have gotten gold for soliciting new donors. Okay. Let's make a slide. Would a person with gold credits want to borrow from it and get silver to give someone else? They could, but silver does not worth more than gold in terms of priority. This just allows a lender to let someone else collect the debt. That has to be allowed because if a person quits, the system needs to have a way to pay them back eventually. Uploading Slide 24. @Whale is now Rank S4 Adding more at the post.
    Wee~~!

    {"type":"chat","id":"202402292000","parentid":"202312251111","parentname":"Arcacian Quest","icon":"ğŸ®","title":"February","prev":"202402282101","author":"LRRH","location":"Game Room"}
    This node discusses concepts about model public education.
    ğŸª Mission
    The mission of public education is to empower the people to voluntarily fulfill all roles of public good.To that end, it includes the keypoints below:
    ğŸ•¯ï¸ Ignition
    Good public education helps everyone discover their spark of creativity so that they remain/become self-motivated learners for their happiness.
    ğŸ§­ Moral
    Good public education helps everyone develop their moral compass so that they can detect wrong laws and practices for society to correct itself.
    ğŸ“– Access
    Good public education makes skills for public good free to learn. In a quest society, aside from the curiosity of the learner, the quests needing the skill drives the learning.
    ğŸ… Reward
    Good public education rewards people who make the education free to the learners.
    ğŸŒ³ Infrastructure: Open Skill Tree
    The infrastructure for public education can be visualized as an open skill tree with these features:
    ğŸ”® Curriculum
    This feature maps the entire catalog of skills for completing public good quests. The catalog entry for a skill should exist as long as it is conceived, even if there is no training available yet.
    ğŸ“š Library
    This feature substantiates the curriculum with learning modules, equipment, facility, and class schedules. The modules can be as simple as a link to a learning resource even if it is external and not free. It is up to the learner to choose which module they want. But it is the mission for public education to create free modules.
    ğŸ… Learner Transcript
    This feature allows the user to bookmark and tag modules and concepts they have already viewed, learned, or certified. With this system, a user can easily see what skills they lack for a given quest. By registering the transcript, the system may also ping the user if a quest in demand needs their skill.
    ğŸ’¬ Forum
    Allows the public to comment on the quality of the content and to share tips on how to learn. The system is basically like the user review section of Amazon, where the product is the learning module, and in addition to star ratings, the comments section can be further tagged. Or if the content of the learning module is a wiki, the users could edit the content to improve its quality.
    ğŸ©º Skill Clinic
    This allows learners or teachers to post their difficulties so they can be directed to the next helpful module or tutor. Addressing all clinic tickets is one of the public good quests in public education.
    â­ Contributor Credits
    This scores credits for contributors who make learning modules, answer tickets, or maintain the infrastructure. Module makers get credits based on the quality and impact of their module in public good. Automatic royalty credits are rewarded when the success of a quest is attributed to the module maker. Just to be clear, we are not talking about the learner's credit, but the teacher's credit. These are credits a user get from teaching well.
    202210062300|ğŸŒ³ Skill Tree
    ğŸ“ Comparisons
    Common Core Standard {"cmd":"url","url":"https://corestandards.org/","desc":"ğŸ”—"} {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.cde.ca.gov/re/cc/whatareccss.asp","desc":"ğŸ”—CA"}
    Common Curriculum for Leadership and Global Citizenship {"cmd":"url","url":"https://commoncurriculum.senate.uconn.edu/diversity-equity-and-social-justice/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}

    {"cmd":"url","url":"https://brilliant.org/","desc":"ğŸ”—"} Brilliant
    ğŸ”® Funding

    {"type":"chat","id":"202403021520","parentid":"202208250038","parentname":"Cardinal Quest","icon":"ğŸª","title":"2403 Status Check","prev":"202402022111","author":"Tanya","location":"Quest Channel"}
    â­
    Could we fresh out the Panacademy node?
    ğŸ’¡LRRH: I think the purpose of public education is for everyone to find their spark and be able to freely learn.
    Ignition, morality, access, reward. Public Education should make all skills related to public good freely accessible without violating autonomy. It rewards those teaching or making teaching artifacts free for all. It seems there are five points: Ignition, moral, coverage, access, reward. Why is making education free a purpose? Couldn't it just be affordable? Free is affordable. Not always. Not always to whom? Part five says the teachers and other helpers are rewarded. So it is free to the learner, and compensated for the providers. My point is, why does it need to be free to the learner? We are not talking about all kinds of learning. We are talking about skills related to fulfilling roles of public good. The point is to empower all to participate in public good. It means that if you are a teacher, but the content you teach or create does not promote public good, then you don't get credits. StarTree please make the slide. Could you start at the node? I think for the guild we need the information at the nodes, since it is harder to edit the slides. The mission of public education is to empower the people to voluntarily fulfill all roles of public good. To that end, it includes the keypoints mentioned above. Roger! Good public education helps everyone discover their "spark" of creativity so that they remain/become self-motivated learners. Should we rank that keypoint as "good" public education or should that be a requirement? I think a question is whether a public education that does not help people discover their spark is it still an acceptable system? I think that would be a failed system. Keeping the spark should be easy. If the system can't do that, the people is better off not having the system. I think it is okay to express the keypoints as a scale without defining at what level the system fails. I think Red's explanation is easier. I see. Then, "Good public education helps everyone develop their moral compass so that they can detect wrong laws and practices for society to correct itself." I think that is a good description. I think it will be repetitive to say Good public education in every keypoint. I think we can edit it after spelling them out. What could be a better word than "coverage"? Good public education covers all skills for public good. Isn't that just the same as Red's mission statement? How about "Good public education makes skills for public good free to learn." I think it should be free or rewarding to learn. Some public good skills takes considerable investment to learn. Maybe it shouldn't be. I think it is okay to add "or rewarding" until we can prove that they don't need to be rewarding. I think we already know that emergency prepareness is worth credits. So we know that some of the learning should be rewarding. Yes, you would pay the learner. What if the learner learns to take the reward but doesn't help when their skill is needed? I think the learner shouldn't be paid that much for preparation. I am geared toward there should be no reward if the training is free. There should be a reward only if there is a shortage of people with the skill, but you could argue that the corresponding quest credit needing that skill is the reward. So the training itself doesn't need a reward. I think Tanya's view makes more sense. We could add a comment that in a quest society, the quests needing the skill drives the learning, along with the innate interest of the learner. That section is access. The last point, reward, "Good public education rewards those who make the education free to the learners." We ended up having four keypoints instead of five. I think this is a good set. @Guild is now Rank B1.
    To be continued...

    Isn't the infrastructure that does public education the skill tree?
    ğŸ”® Open Skill Tree
    ğŸ’¡LRRH: The skill tree shows the skills that a person can learn or have learned, and teachers assign themselves to build lessons for the skill. The only thing that seems to be missing is to connect the skill tree to the quest board, so that a quester can check if they have the skills required or recommended to do a quest. And if they don't, the tree shows them the list of skills to learn in a suggested order.
    Is this a question? Is the Skill Tree the best infrastructure we know to build on for public education? The skills do not necessarily form a tree structure, the general term might be a transcript system that is intergrated with a quest system, forum, and a library of learning materials. It is the World Tree. XD Or at least that is what I want to see as the gamified visualization, which contributes to Ignition. I don't think we have to know whether it is the best infrastructure. We could just explain it first and see if we can get a better one. It is one infrastructure. But in terms of modeling, whether you call the thing a Open Skill Tree or an Open Skill System only differs in the name. So that is more of a stylistic choice. You could just put a note that the viewer may call it something else or apply a different mod for visualization. Agreed. StarTree please add a section for Skill Tree as an infrastructure. Roger! The infrastructure that satisfies the mission of public education can be visualized as an open skill tree, which is a free platform for training, connecting learners, teachers, learning material, and quests pertaining to public good. StarTree will shorten that description! Curriculum: This feature maps the entire catalog of skills related to completing public good quests. The catalog entry for a skill should exist as long as it is conceived, even if there is no training available yet. Learning Modules Library: This feature substantiates the curriculum with learning modules, passive resources, and classes. The modules can be as simple as a link to a learning resource even if it is external and not free. It is up to the learner to choose which module they want. But it is the mission for public education to create free modules. Transcript: The feature allows the user to bookmark and tag modules and concepts they have already viewed, learned, or certified. With this system, a user can easily see what skills they lack for a given quest. By registering the transcript, the system may also ping the user if a quest in demand needs their skill. I think the tree should also have a forum as a feature. It allows the citizenry to comment on the quality of the content and to share tips on how to learn. The system is basically like the user review section of Amazon, where the product is the learning module, and in addition to star ratings, the comments section can be further tagged. Or if the content of the learning module is a wiki, the users could edit the content to improve its quality. Could there also be a feature like a skill clnic where a learner could post their issue and get pointers on what to try next if they have trouble learning a skill? I think that should be there and would be a public good quest to clear the learning issue tickets by helping the learners. Added! I think we are still missing the score keeping system that logs the credits when a user contributes by answering tickets or creating modules. This credit accounting system should take into account of how well a contribution helps the rest of the learners. A contributor who made a good module should get more credits when learners prefer their module. Automatic royalty credits are rewarded when the success of a quest is attributed to the module maker. Just to be clear, we are not talking about the learner's credit, but a teacher's credit. These are credits a user get from teaching well. I think the title should be changed. I think we should change the title of the node. Let's just call it model public education, and make panacademy a subtitle only for the card. Roger! Or just public education. StarTree did something! The name Panacademy is complete gone. It is in the bucket section! XD I think now it is good to have a slide to present Open Skill Tree in the context of public education. Agreed. I ilke this pacing because it is easier to participate. StarTree please feature a world tree tile in the middle of the slide if it can look good. A vision is not effective without effective visual aid. Roger! This looks really nice! and cute! ğŸ˜ Wee~~! If we want people to share this concept we should have a link where they could get the slide. Added a link! Panacademy returns! XD I think the slide is good for adding as March graphics, and please add the link to the node. Posted @Whale is now Rank S3. Adding new CSS for Slide format. Adding another CSS Slide format.     NextDoor now has a block function.
    âš”ï¸ Block Function
    ğŸ”Black: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://help.nextdoor.com/s/article/Block-direct-messages?language=en_US","desc":"ğŸ”—"} This is NextDoor's article about the experimental Block feature. The new part reads: In a few areas, Nextdoor is testing an expanded block feature. Blocking a neighbor prevents them from seeing what you share, finding your Nextdoor profile or interacting with you. It will also block you from viewing their posts, comments or messages. If you are connected, blocking will disconnect you from the neighbor. You can unblock the neighbor anytime from your privacy settings.
    I think the new expanded block breaks the forum's democratic quality. I already emailed NextDoor about it. There should be a slide about it. Agreed. If we plan to make the slides searchable based on quests, we also need to know what quest the slide supports. I think the quest in this case is about protecting a free forum. The forum is already part of OST public education. Maybe the quest and the subject can be the same node: Democratic Forum. The node can explain that it is both a quest and training on how to do the quest. I think that could work. Made 202403050033|node!

    ğŸ“¯ Membership
    A democractic forum should allow all to join.
    No Age Limit There should be no age limit because the content can be filtered with a default children-friendly filter.
    Anonymity OK It should be okay to post anonymously because discussing at a democratic forum doesn't mean there is voting. It is about idea exchange. There may be situations where a user needs to identify themself, but until that situation happens, anonymous posting should be allowed and a user may just apply a filter showing only non-anonymous posts.
    ID or Deposit This is an accountability or anti-spam bot feature, where a joining user needs to provide their unique ID or make a deposit. The deposit is returned if they quit in good standing. In forums where spamming is not an issue, this is unnecessary.
    ğŸŒ¡ï¸ Content Control
    In general content control should be done by filters instead of banning or censoring a user.
    Slide 28
    {"cmd":"img","src":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/Slide_28.png?raw=true"}
    G-rated default The default filter should be G-rated.
    No Blocking A user should not be able to block another user from seeing what they post in public because if they can't see what you post, they can't defend what you post about them in public.
    Daily Limit There might be a daily limit to the number of posts a user can make.
    ğŸ”® Forensics
    These features preserve the context of the discussion so no one can alter them to misrepresent someone's message.
    Timestamp Each post should have a timestamp. If the content can be changed, the history should be shown.
    Post Links Each post should have a link so it can be referenced.
    âš¡ Convenience
    These features are more like nice-to-have features that make discussions easier.
    Hyperlinks Let users insert hyperlinks so they can reference things.
    Block Quote or Annotate Have a block quote or annotation feature so a user can comment on what was said.
    Searchable The content should be searchable.
    Structured Discussion with Overview Some discussions would benefit from a structured medium. For example, when the author posts an issue, a user may post by adding a concern to be addressed. At the top level of the thread, all concerns are listed and show if they have been addressed. This allow a new user to focus on concerns that are not yet addressed.
    Democratic Forum
    Infrastructure
    Where people may discuss to resolve conflicts and coordinate efforts.
    {"id":"202403050033","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"ğŸ’¬","title":"Democratic Forum","subtitle":"Infrastructure","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/02/03/16/56/meeting-1177454_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
    â­
    Someone asked if cookies can be stored in an anonymous browser.
    And the answer is: the browser can store it as long as it is not closed! That defeats most of the purpose for the cookie. So no. Next, there was a request to have a link from Blogspot to Github. The links is now added on the About page! Could we fresh out the content of Democratic Forum? New section!
    ğŸ“¯ Democratic Forum
    Black: What do you see as the purpose or features of a democratic forum?
    The forum is a necessary infrastructure for democracy. It is the means for people to resolve conflicts and coordinate efforts. Everyone should be allowed to join. If you don't like what someone says, you may filter out what they say, but that filter should only apply to your view. Other people can still see what they post. I think there should be a default filter so that a newcomer does not see offensive messages. They should be informed that a filter is in effect so they may turn it off. The default filter should be G-rated so it is child safe. Same as Zoey's and you can't block anyone from seeing what you post in the public section. That is because if they can't see what you post, they can't defend themself if you post something about them. What about the more fundamental issue of whether a user may be anonymous? I think in general the user can be anonymous. Democracy doesn't imply that there is voting. Posts should have a timestamp. I just want to mention that an advantage, as least for now, of an online chat forum is that the discussion is already transcribed as it happens. The forum platform needs to allow hyperlinks. Each post needs a jumpable link. Why are we casting attacks? ğŸ˜… Might as well level up something. XD It should be searchable. Are we going to rank these features? I think some of them are not necessary. StarTree please fill up the node and categorize. Roger! Structured Discussion with Overview: Some discussions would benefit from a structured medium. For example, when the author posts an issue, a user may post by adding a concern to be addressed. At the top level of the thread, all concerns are listed and they show if it has already been addressed. This allow a new user to focus on concerns that are not yet addressed. If you allow everyone to post, how do you protect the forum from someone robo posting to flood it with trash? I think there could be a limit to how much a user may post each day, unless you are doing a quest for answering tickets. The difference between a daily posting limit and censorship is that you can still post every day and the limit applies to everyone. Daily posting limits do not work on bots. How about for an online forum, you need to be a real person to join. But once you have joined, you may post anonymously. How do you phrase no robo posters? Maybe there could be a verification process. Unless you are verified, your daily post limit would be very low. Once you are verified, you may still choose to post anonymously, but your anonymous posts also count toward your daily limit. A million unverified bots posting once per day is the same as one bot posting a million times a day. Maybe a condition to join is to provide a person's unique Gaia ID. This is an accountability issue. If you commit a crime on the forum, the forum knows who you are to hold you accountable. Spamming the forum, with bots or by yourself, should be a violation. If your spamming is costing significant resources, then it is deducted from your Gaia account. I think this might be similar how Twitter(X) said it might do, that when you make an account you have to at least pay one copper. It could be a deposit. But that only matters if it doesn't have your Gaia ID. If they have your Gaia ID they don't need the deposit. Acceptable.
    @Mira is now Rank B1.
    Wee~~!

    On the topic of trolling, I want to distinguish between calling someone a troll and being able to identify unhelpful content or behavior that is called trolling.
    StarTree please make node. The parent is set to "Constructive Feedback", which also has notes on destructive responses! I don't know how you want to define trolling, but I want a section on the difference of calling someone a troll versus identifying what behaviors are seen as trolling. "Trolling refers to unhelpful discussion tactics aimmed to distract the participants from resolving the discussion topic." It also includes discussions that were started without an aim to resolve the topic. I think the parent should have a link to the child topic. Added! Instead of calling someone a troll, you could instead identify what part of their comment is helpful or unhelpful, on-topic or off-topic.
    @Dungeon is now Rank A3.
    The node needs a link to Wikipedia for comparison. Added! This topic reminds me of an exercise in non-violence training. I think we should talk about that but it is not at top priority. If Notion is maxing out, you should queue and rank the topics at NextDoor node. Or I could just queue them at NextDoor. NextDoor has a word count limit per post, and you can't collapse them.     Reformatting the node for Charters and placing it as a Herald skill. Updating the herald node format and layout. In Arena, there is a topic of cursive writing. Where should this skill be? In Open Skill Tree? I think it should be an elective. What is an elective? Or rather, what isn't an elective? Good point. It is an orphaned skill until there is an art or archival quest that qualifies as public good. Should it be grouped as a herald skill or should it be a separate curriculum list not related to peacemaking. I think the two lists will overlap too much, so you could just add it as a herald language skill. I think that task being in Arena meant we are supposed to discuss whether cursive should be required. My answer is that it should not be "required" because no skill is required. A skill can be required for a quest. But a person is not required to do any particular quest, so a person is not required to learn a skill. It is a carrot system. Okay.

    {"type":"chat","id":"202403091019","parentid":"202207252131","parentname":"Cleric","icon":"âš”ï¸","title":"Trolling","prev":"202403082352","author":"Evelyn","location":"Game Room"}
    Trolling refers to unhelpful discussion tactics aimmed to distract the participants from resolving the discussion topic, or an invitation to a discussion without a genuine aim to resolve the topic.
    Troll vs Trolling
    In general it is not appropriate to call someone a troll even when their behavior is the same as a troll because whether they are a troll is a judgment, not a fact. Instead of calling someone a troll, you could instead identify what part of their comment is helpful or unhelpful, on-topic or off-topic.
    Trolling
    Behavior

    ğŸ””
    The law game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children, and that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
    [38] Illegal Substance
    ğŸ“¯Natalie: Ann is trying to buy illegal drug from Bob, but Bob is a scammer and sold her a bag of ordinary spice. If the zone prohibits possession of illegal drug, did Ann commit the physical act of possession?
    Ann is not guilty because what she has it not illegal drug. Agreed. Not guilty. Factually no, but mentally yes, if she didn't know that the bag was just spice. The answer is opposite. Ann committed physical possession because she has the object. But if the crime is based on the metanl state of strict liability, then Ann would be found innocent because the object is not illegal drug. If the crime is not based on strict liability then Ann would be guilty.
    @Paladin is now Rank B2. This is the first game in March 2024!
    {"type":"chat","id":"202403102020","parentid":"202301011739","parentname":"Law Game","icon":"âš–ï¸","title":"Law Game 108","prev":"202402232020","author":"Natalie","location":"Paladin Hall"}
    â­
    Okay everyone. Trial by Trolley is a rather messed up game with the premise of choosing the less bad outcome. Let's try to play it. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/282171/trial-trolley","desc":"ğŸ”—BGG"}
    I thought it is against Magic Bakery rule to create a scenario that would bring harm to NPC. I suppose at some point you can intervene so no one gets hurt. But why play at all? ğŸ˜– Okay. The way the game works is that each path will eventually have about 4 cards. I will place a card each on both paths, and you decide what can be done.
    ğŸš¨ First in line
    ğŸ©Sasha: The upper track has your favorite author. The lower track has a critical cable holding up the Golden Gate Bridge.
    The cable, since we could stop the cars from going to the bridge. If you have time to stop the cars, you could have pulled the favorite author off the track. I feel that I don't want to learn how to play this game. ğŸ˜– Why exactly are we debating when only one pair is revealed? Don't we need to know all cards? Think of this as a tutorial. You don't have to comment if you want to wait until all cards are revealed. Showing the next pair now.
    ğŸš¨ Second in line
    ğŸ©Sasha: Upper track: Your favorite author and a rare and beautiful flower that contains the cure to cancer and AIDS. Lower track: A critical cable holding up the Golden Gate Bridge and a crowded mother's day brunch buffet.
    I see. The Paladin solution is to stop the trolley. You only need to derail it. I think it is easier to remove the victims from the upper track. If you think like that you could also think in terms of which track has fewer people to heal or rez. ğŸ˜– That shouldn't be the solution to this issue.
    ğŸš¨ Third in line
    ğŸ©Sasha: Upper track: Author, Flower, and a horrible 10-year old influencer who makes way more money than you. Lower track: Cable, Buffet, and a creepy possessed doll.
    It is still the top having fewer people. Maybe we shouldn't discuss this until Sasha plays all cards. If we discuss, Sasha knows how to put the next card to make the tracks harder to choose. I think she can already do that by herself. Last card.
    ğŸ” Discovery and Decision
    Sasha: The detectives reveal that: the 10-year old kid on the upper track just joined the priesthood and will one day invent the world's most addictive smartphone app.
    Derail the trolley, move everyone off the upper track, heal and rez as needed. I cast Protect. I derail the trolley. I summon Giant Toad to snatch the trolley off the rail. XD I remove the flower. I call for help and make sure that if the trolley is not stopped, it goes to the upper track. I pick up the kid on the upper track. Is Sasha doing anything? XD I am not doing anything. May I move the author after casting protect? P4 helps Evelyn move the author. Okay. There is no time for any other action. Cardinal.
    Everyone with an action please roll 3+. Ledia: â–â–â•â•â– Zoey: â•â•â–â•â•â– Tanya: â–â•â•â– Evelyn: â•â•â•â– P4: â•â•â•â– Black: â•â•â•â– LRRH: â–â•â–â•â–
    âš”ï¸ Result
    Cardinal: As the out-of-control trolley speeds to the split, the team scrammbles and removes the author and flower from the upper track.     Zoey, what do you do with the trolley? The giant toad digests the trolley and splits out Sasha in a pool of slime. XD As she said. If this is how the dice roll will resolve the issue, we need everyone to stop the trolley. You mean everyone who can stop the trolley to stop the trolley? I think we did that already. Ledia and Zoey are the most combaty on scene. Unless you want to blow up the trolley. I think it is implied that the trolley has at least the conductor on it. Even if we nuke the trolley, that is just one conductor. P4's effort could be in removing the conductor from the trolley. It sounds like we should have a game two to refine our learning. ğŸ˜– There is no risk. Cardinal just dramatized for the sake of drama.     ğŸ””
    The law game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children, and that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
    [43] Inaction
    ğŸ“¯Natalie: Ann and Bob are a married couple. They are ice skating on a frozen pond when Bob falls through the ice. If Ann skates happily away knowing that no one is close enough to save Bob, is Ann guilty of murder?
    ğŸ˜– My games weren't the only ones that were messed up. Not guilty, since Bob fell into the water by himself. Don't married couples have a duty to save each other? But that is not murder. Agreed. Not murder. Maybe the crime is not murder, but I think there might be a law that between a husband and wife, they have a duty to save each other. There should be an oath when they were married. ğŸ˜– I would consider it a legitimate argument that if Ann didn't try to save Bob, their oath or marriage could be broken and that could void any benefit to Ann that she could receive as Bob's widow. I am not so sure if that oath has any legal meaning. I think that is part of common law. Even if it is not part of common law, I think this game has more to do with what we think should be correct. The card's answer is YES. The wife has a legal duty to help due to the marriage. In this case, the wife committed murder. Even though she didn't plan for Bob to fall into the water, she planned to let him drown given the situation. The duty arises from the relationship including parent-child relation.
    @Happy is now Rank B3. This is the second game in March 2024!

To build the timeline. It sounds like someone is interested in keep playing this. StarTree. Done! Zoey: Pirate, Witch, Nazca. Do we get points for getting it right?     Let's also try to play Munchkins.
    Munchkins come in many different sets. I have never played it, and I thought it would be similar to what we want in Arcacian Quest. So this thread might be less about playing but more about learning and seeing if there is anything we can use for AQ. The log shows we have three boxes of Munchkins. Yes, and Pathfinder and other RPG board games. So let's get to it. Cardinal please assist.
    ğŸ” About the Game
    Sasha: The game itself is competitive. The players build characters, fight monsters, and try to be the first to reach level 10. As they fight monsters, they get treasures, which gives them cards that they can boost themselves or the enemy (so that the enemy monster could defeat a competing hero). For AQ we don't need the competitive play. So who wants to playtest this with me?
    I'll play. I'll play. We are going to just play with all open cards. Rule is that each player start with 4 Door cards and 4 Treasure cards. I'll just deal them to you. Okay. There are too many cards so I am not going to describe what each person got. So I know your cards, but you don't know each others' cards unless you share them. You're supposed to deal cards with Cardinal. XD Okay. Cardinal will deal next time.
    âš”ï¸ Escape from the Dungeon
    Cardinal: Sasha, Casey, and Zoey teleported themselves to a training dungeon with many doors. To escape, all three of them must reach level 3 or above. To gain a level, they may sell 1000 gold worth of treasures, or defeat a monster. When all three players have reached Level 3 or above, there will be a final showdown of all monsters still in the players' hands.
    Heroes, which one of you would like to kick open the first door? Is this now cooperative? Apparently. If you have Race or Equipment cards, you should play them now. Once the door is open, there is no time to equip. You must fight if it is a monster. I don't have any monster card. I play my Dragon Armor and Magic Bassoon for a total of +8. If you don't play a race or class card, you are considered a human with no class. I have two monster cards, Level 4 and Level 8. I equip a Hercules Bow and Arrows for +4. XD Do we have to use up all the curse cards on each other before escaping? Yes. I have three monster cards. I play the Go Up a Level card. I am now Level 2. Do we all fight the same monster? The player kicking the door must fight. They may invite one other player to fight with them. That doesn't really make sense. I think we should just all fight together. Before Casey is a narrow hallway. It seems that only one helper is possible if the door is kicked. I kick the door. Casey receives a Wandering Monster card. There is no other monster in the room. Casey may choose to fight a monster in hand or loot the room. But since Casey doesn't have any monster. Casey loots and gets a treasure card. Casey, you have more than 5 cards in hand, you must play enough down to 5 cards or give the extra to another player. I change my equipment and play the Centaur race. I now have +12 bonus. And I give my Wandering Monster card to Sasha. Zoey, it is your turn to kick down a door. Can Sasha kick first? I want to use up some curse cards on her. Zoey looks at Sasha deviously, telling her to go first. Sasha can handle those curses. XD I kick the door.
    âš”ï¸ Door 2 (Sasha)
    ğŸ©Cardinal: As Sasha kicks the door open, a trap arrow shoots just above Sasha's head.
    It was just a curse card for Sasha to lose a headgear, but Sasha had no headgear. Now Sasha may summon a monster from her hand. Okay everyone, let's do this. I summon a Level 8 Jersey Devil and use my wandering monster to summon a Level 1 Earwig. That is just a total of 9 attack. Casey come destroy it. I also use a curse on myself to lose a big item, which I have none. I curse Sasha twice for Sasha to lose her class, which she has none, and for her to be unable to use any combat bonus other than hand items for the next fight. That isn't totally harmless. At least you can plan ahead. XD You could have cursed yourself. I didn't think of that. XD I destroy the monsters with my +12 bonus. Per the game rules, Sasha gains two levels. She is now Level 4. And Sasha draws 3 treasures I use a wishing ring to uncurse myself, then I give Greek Fire to Casey. I am good.
    âš”ï¸ Door 3 (Zoey)
    Cardinal: Zoey opens the door and remembered a skill.
    Zoey, you may play a monster card or loot. I am going to solo a Level 8 Monster. XD I use Argo Knots to add 5 to my attack for total of 10 attack to defeat the Level 8 monster. Zoey is now Level 2 and gains two treasures. I play my Thief class card, and Steal Your Thunder card on Sasha. XD Both Sasha and Zoey are now Level 3. That was completely unnecessary. You are not even maxed out. It is not unnecessary. It moves the game along. XD I don't have a monster. Can Sasha kick the door again? My monster is Level 18. My attack is only 5. Your attack is 13, We are now one level short of killing it thanks to Zoey. Trust me, we can kill it. Just do it. XD I kick the door.
    âš”ï¸ Door 4 (Sasha)
    Cardinal: As Sasha opens the door, an item went from Sasha to each other hero.
    Oh well, I don't need them. You know what, I am just going to loot and give my monster to Casey because if my monster is defeated during my round, I get the level. But I don't need more levels. As Sasha decides to loot, Sasha went up another level. Casey now has my monster. The monster did not transfer. (You can only trade cards that are already in play. You can't trade from your hand.) We just lost a whole turn! It's okay, Casey needs to level up anyway. I kick the door.
    âš”ï¸ Door 5 (Casey)
    Cardinal: Casey kicks the door open and was greeted by a faceless Level 12 Slender Man.
    Okay. Let me do this right. First I curse myself to take a flesh wound. I lose a level but that has no effect because I am already level 1. Next, I curse myself to lose my race. I am now just human. Then I just attack with my 13 attack. Casey destroys the Slender Man and gains 3 treasures. Two of them are Go up a level cards. Casey is now Level 4. I give my extra card to Zoey. Don't we just fight now? This is the final boss room. Zoey kicks the door open...
    âš”ï¸ Boss Room
    Cardinal: In the Boss Room is a Level 29 Chimera that is weak against fire.
    My power is 3+4+10 = 17 XD Is this fight still just for 2 people? My attack is 6 total, but I can +2 to the fight even if I am not in it. I think we got this with just Zoey and me. My attack is 13+5 = 18. That is with fire attack. So the Boss is just Level 24. The team destroys the Boss monster and Zoey gains 3 levels and 7 treasures. Zoey takes the lead at Level 6.
    ğŸ”® Discussion
    Sasha: Okay. How is this game? Is it playable? What can we get from it?
    I think it is quite playable as a competitive game, but as a co-op it would be too easy. I think if we play it in co-op, we need to all kick a door at the same time and draw as many door cards as there are players. I agree, then we can all level up instead of having just the kicker level up. I think if we have to level to level 10, the game would be too long, and kind of pointless if the players are not competing. Defusing the curse cards is just a chore. Once you got rid of the curse cards from your initial hand, the curses come applied. I think it is fine. What I am getting is that this game is playable as is. No minis, no map, no tiles, mostly no die rolls. Just two decks of cards. The cards don't need any special designs because most of the time each player only has five cards in their hands. Isn't this kind of what we want for a convenient AQ design? I think it is worth thinking about. So instead of monsters, the Door deck would have quest cards? This game only has one main value: the level or the attack power. If we still do Spot-it style it might be complicated. But since AQ is co-op, for 3 players, together we have 15 cards in hands plus other class or equipment cards already on the table. I think at least lately, making slides is more helpful than making game cards. I feel the same. Maybe at some point we will come back to make cards after we already have slides for that content. Okay. Let's let it brew in the backburner as we explore more different games. @Treasure is now Rank B3. Sasha is recognized for the Magician skill Backburner.
    Let's try each game at least once.
