    â­
    Hey hey hey, let's weigh some crates!
    ğŸ§© Puzzle
    ğŸ§©Mikela: At a warehouse, you have four crates from yesterday and four crates from today. One of the crates from today has a counterfeit item so it is either lighter or heavier. What is the fewest number of weighings you need to always determine which crate has the counterfeit and whether the counterfeit is lighter or heavier?
    What kind of scale do you have? This kind: âš–ï¸ Black: Four from yesterday against four from today to know whether the counterfeit is lighter or heavier. Then, two from today against the other two from today to know which two has the counterfeit. Finally 1 vs 1 to know which crate has the counterfeit. So 3 weighings total. Your method will always take three weighings. Tanya: First weigh two from yesterday against two from today. If they are different, you know whether the counterfeit is lighter or heavier, and you also know in which group of two the counterfeit is in. Then you use the second weighing on those two crates. This gives just two weighings... If the first weighing shows the same weight on today's Crate A and B, then weigh one from yesterday against today's crate C. If C has the counterfeit, you also know whether the counterfeit is too light or too heavy. That also gives 2 weighings... Finally, if the second weighing is also the same, you would just do a third weighing of one from yesterday against today's crate D. That gives 3 weighings. On average, the result is 2.25 weighings. Then I think the answer should be 2. Gotta think harder. Casey: First weigh three from yesterday and three from today. If they weigh the same, use the second weighing on the fourth crate against a good crate from yesterday. If they don't weigh the same, you already know whether the counterfeit is lighter or heavier. Then pick two from the group of three today and weigh them against each other. If they weigh the same, the third crate is the counterfeit. If they are different, you also know which one is the counterfeit. So just two weighings total no matter what. I see. Mikela: Casey is the winner! Congratulations! Good puzzle.
    @Puzzle is now Rank
    Cheers!

{"name":"Fina","score":"1"}, {"name":"V","score":"1"} ]}
    â­
    Designer City or Evolution of Democracy. Let's make the next slide.
    ğŸ”® Designer City
    ğŸ”Black: This topic came about when someone was surprised when they learned about the plan to turn a small vacant parcel in the neighborhood into a 4-story apartment.
    Along with that, there is a topic of how a city would go about designing/deciding for its future. There is also a complication on what should a city do when it is assigned goals. I think we can ignore the third topic. It should be illegal for the city to be assigned a goal. So the city should just resist or fight back and remove the power doing the assignment. For the design, it starts with just visions where people could endorse like kick start. With the endorsement, either the project bids for a site for development, or a city bids for a transformation proposal. The design could be as big as a city or as small as a house. I think a block or a few would be a good size for any theme also. So when you create a design vision, it is an actual archetecture plan with population and area size. Suppose you designed a city block for a thousand people. Then you post it and wait for a thousand endorsers. How do you deal with complaints during the endorsement process? If the location is not decided, what do they complain about? Let's think in terms of a city that has a piece of vacant land of size X. At any given time, there are projects of size X that already have enough endorsement. How does the city decide whether they let any given endorsed project to take the land? Priority Currency and Gaia Credits. If that piece of land happens to be "in the city" but the city has not reserved it, then it is up for grasp. If the city has reserved and doesn't want to yield, that is the city's autonomy. Can the people who reserved the land build whatever they want? The point of a designer city, as opposed to a patchwork city, is that a designer city already has an overall plan. It is not up to the individual parcel owners to decide. A designer city is more like a hotel, the hotel adminstration decides the vision and solicit endorsers. As long as there are enough endorsers, the city can maintain its size. If it is built but does not get enough endorsers, it must yield its sections. The inhabitants should not be surprised. It is basically like a Disney resort village or a section with HOA. I think we need to show the movement of the population. The system implies that people will relocate when the population of a city reaches a divergent point where they disagree with future plans. At that point there is a decision on who should keep the existing city and who should relocate. Say there are two cities, and both of them have a 60% population endorsing design A and 40% endorsing design B. If the inhabitants agree to relocate, they could result in two cities developing different visions. How do you facilitate people who want to relocate? The relocation should be spontaneous. The question should be what kept them from moving or swapping residences. One of the obstacles might be tax during title transfer. I think relocating to help others join a vision should worth some credits. But if you are swapping, you are already benefited. I think helping people move for free should worth credits. Agreed.
    @Treasure is now Rank B4.
    Let's try each game at least once.

    {"type":"chat","id":"202403142035","parentid":"202209212113","parentname":"Stages of Democracy","icon":"ğŸ‘‘","title":"Stages of Democracy","prev":"202403112159","author":"Black","location":"Game Room"}
    Oversight is a principal's means to detect misbehavior of their agent. In a democractic society, it is the general public's means to see if their government agent has misappropriated public resources or abused its powers. This node explains what a vigilant reviewer should check on an oversight report. That is: How to oversee the overseer! XD
    ğŸ“‹ Accessibility Requirements
    An oversight report should be intuitively accessible to the principal because the purpose of the report is to maximize the principal's ability to detect faults.

    What to check

    1. Existence: Does the decision or subject to be overseen mention the existence of such report?
    2. Proximity: Is the report presented near where the principal needs to make a relevant decision?
    3. Permission: Is the report viewable by the principal decision maker?
    4. Grouping: Is the report reachable in the same location where similar or related reports can be found?
    5. Directory: Is the directory structure intuitive for a viewer to find it?
    6. Searchability: Can the report be found from a general search?
    If it fails, it means that the author or the keeper of the report did not aim to maximize the principal's ability to exercise their autonomy. Tanya: The crime commited by an agent to prevent their principal from making a fair decision is fraud. That is grounds to invalidate the committee, since now the principal needs to commission another committee to oversee the original one.
    Slide: Oversight Report Requirement

    Albatross
    The Flying Caesar
     {"id":"202403161735","parentid":"202308240930","parentname":"Stories","icon":"â„ï¸","title":"Albatross","subtitle":"The Flying Caesar","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2019/09/27/12/39/landscape-4508444_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Albatross","description":"","card-text":""}

    Daggerheart is out for open beta. What do you think?
    ğŸ€ Character Creation
    ğŸ”Evelyn: I think character creation doesn't really apply to us, although I like how the cards have ideas for characters.
    I prefer how in our game we don't really need to think about what skills we have when we make our characters. We just say what skill we have when we want to use it, and we get a placement roll. I prefer letter ranking over numerical stats. The system seems too complicated. After playing Munchkin. XD To be fair, how exactly do we create a character when we play? We don't. We are just playing ourselves. XD When we join a game, we gave a short description of what we are. The description could be very short. I was just Little Red Riding Hood the Baker. The rest doesn't need to be described unless the player finds it relevant, such as when they want to gain an advantage for a roll or be recognized for a skill. Are these rules written somewhere? It is explained in Skill. I think there should be a section on just character creation near the top. Cardinal Core: The game is designed for new players of any level to drop in and start playing with minimal character creation. You could start with just your name and any title you choose, such as "Little Red Riding Hood the Baker". You could fresh out the rest of your character as you discover what skills and background you may bring for the quest. Is that enough? I think that is enough because that was what we did. ğŸ˜… I think an important aspect is that you are making a character based on what you want to be. You don't need to know how the game works. In comparison to other systems, when you create your character there are no attributes to assign and no game rules you need to learn. Okay let's move on to the next topic.
    âš”ï¸ Gameplay
    Sasha: What do you think about the gameplay? Especially the use of Fear and Hope during dice roll.
    I like how when we play, each of us describes what we want to do and we all roll at the same time. I think it is much faster and we need to roll a lot less. I think since we can add skills at anytime, we don't need to decide whether our character is for combat or roleplay. You can always add or try a relevant skill as you play. There was a limit to how many skills you may add based on your character level. We just didn't keep track because we all have very high levels in the guild. Evelyn = Level 98. XD ğŸ˜… The Fear and Hope points are like SP or mana for the GM and players. In our case I think we don't keep track of Fear because the GM just does thing for dramatic effect. We used to keep track of mana. That hasn't been done for a long time. If you do something that should be stressful for your character, the GM could ask you to roll for OOM. This prevents a player from doing too much for the quest and give other players their chance to shine. But you still keep track of Hitpoints. Currently there is no plan to remove hitpoints. We need a section on our approach on mana. For gameplay, I like how we use it as an opportunity to conceive and recognize new skills. I think that should be a major difference between our system and other. In other systems, the player already knows what skills they have and are trying to find opportunities to use them. In our system, the players can create new skills on the fly. Added. I think that is all I can think of to talk about. I like it when our gameplay is not violent, and we don't focus too much on combat. When we are not fighting, hitpoint doesn't really matter. I think Evelyn needs more combat skills. ğŸ˜… There is no plan to try Daggerheart. So this is it, folks. Until next time!
    @Cardinal is now Rank A4.
    â­ Mastery Slide
    ğŸ©Black: I think this gaming topic transits well into a slide I want to make about skill mastery. In the game, Rank A means rolling 3+. For Open Skill Tree, I think a more relevant description of mastery is this:
    â­: You are aware of the skill and you could identify when a quest needs this skill.
    â­â­: You may successfully complete this skill with instruction, guidance, or supervision.
    â­â­â­: You can routinely perform this skill without supervision or instruction.
    â­â­â­â­: You have demonstrated that you know the skill enough to teach it or recreate the training if OST is destroyed.
    â­â­â­â­â­: You are at the forefront expanding humanity's knowledge and training on this skill.
    No star means you don't know about the skill or you can't tell when a quest requires the skill. I think this scale would be more useful if there are titles in addition to the star rating. For example, maybe 1-star can be called "awareness" proficiency? I think the term for 1-star can be "informed" or "Initiate". If you want to use a noun describing the quester. I think it can be initiate. Which level should be master? I think that would be 4-star. With 2-star being apprentice, 3-star being practicioner, 5-star being Pioneer. A pioneer doesn't always know more than an expert or a master. A pioneer can be someone who knows something specific in the field, but an expert has boarder knowledge about the field, making them a better trainer. I think in that case, in the board scope, there might be no pioneer on the board skill, but if you go into specific sub skills, there are pioneers. I see. Yup. 3-star means Rank B right? If you are Rank B in a skill you only roll 2+. I think that is fine being called a practitioner. At master level you roll 3+. That is basically a Senpai level. Success rate of 3+ is just about 87.5%. That seems low for a "master". I think it is okay to have such low success rate. It reminds people to crosscheck each other, since a "Master" isn't perfect. I don't think we need to show the dice roll on the slide. It doesn't directly translate unless you consider that when a master does the work, although they could do it purely from memory, they would also double check their work. The ranking is reflecting what happens if they have no access to any reference manual. I think my complaint is that an A being 87.5% is a little low, and a "Master" should be someone who can perform at A+ level, so that should be around 97% or what we call Rank S. Maybe if you are a pioneer in a skill, you just get a separate pioneer badge in addition to your proficiency. You mean a master should be Rank S, Pioneer should be Rank SS? I think a pioneer is not necessarily someone who can teach. So that should be a separate badge. I think a person can teach before they can perform the skill perfectly. But if you can't perform at A+, I don't think you have mastered the skill. Maybe Rank A should just be "Instructor" level, but Rank S is "Master." I think Sasha's naming scale is better. Agreed. On an Open Skill Tree, who marks the mastery of a skill? I think initially, the learner can just mark themselves. When the system is connected to a quest and performance database, then the proficiency can be deduced based on the quester's quest quality.
    To be continued...

    â­
    There are two Skill Tree nodes.
    This is not an entirely important subject, but there are now at least two Skill Tree nodes. There are more if you count each archetype node as a skill tree node.     @Happy is now Rank A4.
    â­ Skill Mastery Slide
    Black: StarTree please make a node for Skill Mastery.
    Roger! In an open skill tree, the main reasons for having a mastery rating is for the learner to be aware of what skills they need to learn for the quest they want to do, and for the society to detect which skill needs more people to master. Initiate (1-star). An initiate knows about the skill and can recognize when a quest requires that skill. An initiate may not know how to do the skill, but by knowing about this skill, they can look up resources to learn and then do the quest. Beginner (2-star). A beginner can complete the skill by following instruction or under supervision. A beginner may not be able to perform without notes, or they may not be able to judge whether the result is correct by themself. Practitioner (3-star). A practitioner can perform the skill by themself without supervision. As a practitioner, when you read the quest you should have a good grasp of how that skill is applicable to the quest, and have the general confidence that you can perform. Instructor (4-star). An instructor can teach and correct others on the skill from memory. The instructor rating is especially important for the skill tree because if the skill tree is destroyed, they are the people who can rebuild the tree from scratch. For public good skills, society should check the number of people who have reached instructor level. When an important skill lacks instructors, it would reward people for reaching that proficiency. Master (5-star). A master is at the forefront exploring and sharing new techniques of that skill. A master can in general perform the skill without fail. A master can be seen as inventors, founders, pioneers of the skill. A pioneer is a special badge to mark the founder of a skill or expanded humanity's knowledge of an existing skill.
    @Skill is now Rank A5.
    Making icons. Points logging for Slide 31. This color scheme and icons look the best so far. It looks really cute. ğŸ¤— Black is recognized as a Herald.
    To be continued...

    Emotional Intelligence refers to skills on understanding your own and other's emotion to have effective communication and teamwork.

    Validating the other person's feelings {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.inc.com/justin-bariso/emotionally-intelligent-people-use-a-simple-3-word-phrase-to-show-empathy-strengthen-their-relationships.html","desc":"*3"}
    Emotional Intelligence
    Cleric Skill
    Debuff emotional obstacles for effective teamwork.
    {"id":"202403172052","parentid":"202207252131","parentname":"Cleric Skills","icon":"â¤ï¸","title":"Emotional Intelligence","subtitle":"Skill","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/08/01/09/04/dog-2563759_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Evelyn","description":"","card-text":""}
    This node describes mastery ratings applicable to an 202210062300|open skill tree.
    ğŸ“’ Purpose
    In an open skill tree, the main reasons for having a mastery rating is for the learner to be aware of what skills they need to learn for the quest they want to do, and for the society to detect which skill need more people to master.
    ğŸŒ± Initiate

    Rank D / â­

    An initiate knows about the skill and can recognize when a quest requires that skill. An initiate may not know how to do the skill, but they can start learning it find someone who knows it to complete the quest.
    ğŸ¤ Beginner

    Rank C / â­â­

    A beginner can complete the skill by following a manual or with supervision. A beginner may not be able to perform without without notes, or they may not be able to judge whether the result is correct by themself.
    ğŸ•Šï¸ Practitioner

    Rank B / â­â­â­

    A practitioner can perform the skill by themself without supervision. As a practitioner, when you read the quest you should have a good grasp of how that skill is applicable to the quest, and have the general confidence that you can perform.
    ğŸ¦‰ Instructor

    Rank A / â­â­â­â­

    An instructor can teach and correct others on the skill from memory. The instructor rating is especially important for the skill tree because if the skill tree is destroyed, they are the people who can rebuild the tree from scratch. For public good skills, society should check the number of people who have reached instructor level. When an important skill lacks instructors, it should reward people to reach that proficiency.
    ğŸ¦… Master / Pioneer

    Rank S / â­â­â­â­â­

    A master is at the forefront exploring and sharing new techniques of that skill. A master can perform the skill without fail in general. A master can be seen as inventors, founders, pioneers of the skill in expanding humanity's knowledge of the skill.
    Skill Mastery
    Rubric
    Initiate -> Beginner -> Practitioner -> Instructor -> Master -> Pioneer

    There was a question on how to keep a discussion from turning into personal attacks.
    (Point logging for the asker.) To that I said they could use the first post as a scoreboard that indexes to points with merits, invalid points, and foul moves. A sane person seeing it can identify which side has merits. The problem is that if the score keeper is also part of the debate, the foul speaker would just derail the topic and complain about the scoring instead. I think we also need a slide on how to detect people who are not morally sound.

    Black: This is for making a slide on how to spot broken moral compass.
    I think the left side can desribe what a moral compass is. The middle signs of broken compass, and the right side how to traing for a good moral compass. Making Slide 31. StarTree please change the node name from Moralism to Moral Compass. It sounds more natural. Roger! Classifying this as a Paladin Skill! Adding category names in Paladin Skills.

    How to Teach Moral
    ğŸ“Œ44: Is there a class that can teach kids moral?
    Did you make [slide 32] as a game? You can do it as a game, like marking on a calendar on each day the kid notices a moral topic. I can't find any free and high quality lesson from a simple google search. What do they already know about moral? ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸ If you ask them if they know what morality is, what do they say? They probably don't know how to describe it... maybe example based teaching will be more suitable, do you think? I think you should ask them first because they already watch hero cartoons, so they would have a sense of what it means to be a hero or a good guy. For example, you could ask them what characters they know are good guys. If they can give examples and they don't know what moral is, you can ask them how they know those characters are good guys, or what do good guys do. Once they can identify what good guys do, you can explain that to have good moral is to do good deeds. I think these ideas should be part of the node. Should start with ChatGPT pointers. Lead by Example: Model the moral behavior you want the children to learn: Honesty, kindness, empathy, and respect. Open Communication: make it okay to discuss moral dilemmas, ethical issues, and their feelings. Storytelling: Tell stories that illustrate moral concepts. Teachable Moments: Recognize everyday situations to impart moral lessons. Set Clear Expectations: Set clear expectations for behavior, explain the underlying moral principles and reinforce good behavior with praise and recognition. Address misbehavior with constructive feedback and guidance. Encourage Critical Thinking: By encouraging them to consider the consequences of their actions on themselves and others. Encourage them to question, analyze, and reflect upon moral issues instead of accepting the rules at face value. Perspective Taking: Encourage them to consider the feelings and perspectives of others. Use Positive Reinforcement: Reinforce good behavior with praise, rewards, or privileges. With Patience and Consistency: Remember that teaching morals is a gradual process and be consistent in your messages and expectations. Recognize that children may make mistake and use them as opportunities for learning rather than punitive measures. ChatGPT takes the lead. XD Since 44 asked for examples, I think we should come up with some examples. I think the order of the points are scrambled. I think the earliest method should be storytelling. I think perspective training should happen before storytelling. You need perspective taking to understand stories. I think you need to tell some stories to show the perspectives of different characters before you can do perspective training, such as asking them what they think a new character they read is trying to do. I see. If you break something you should admit you did it. That is integrity. I think we need a list of values. They can be part of "Clear Expectations". Don't hurt other people for fun. Stop bullies and help the victims. I think for kids, it should be okay if they seek help to stop bullies. Report and seek help when something is wrong. Honesty: Don't lie to get what you want. Moral Values should be its own section before the teaching section. Reformatted! Respect: Let others choose what they want when their choices do not prevent others from choosing also.
    @Carrot is now Rank S4.

XD {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.addictionhelp.com/social-media-addiction/statistics/","desc":"ğŸ”—"} Isn't Instagram for photos? That's all Evelyn should know. XD Okay. ğŸ˜… Instead of Instagram, maybe Deviant Art? ChatGPT what is the best place to post educational slides to reach younger audience? SlideShare, Google Slides, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok. This article says Slideshare is dead, and it doesn't allow reupload. We are using reupload at GitHub. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.marketingprofs.com/articles/2018/39731/rip-slideshare-it-was-good-while-it-lasted","desc":"ğŸ”—"} We shouldn't be making slides because they aren't text searchable. We should just use slides as drafts and implement the content in the nodes. Or start at the node and take a screenshot for the slide. This decision could be recurring, we need to link it to a node. I think it is acceptable to draft in the node and have the slide be the final outcome. A slide can be attached to a post and it is easier to read. I think the slides need a border to show the context. Added quest details at OST to upgrade the slide format, define the workflow of slide making, and decide where to put the slides! Okay. Let's shelf this topic for now and think about it. Why? XD Because I am here!
    ğŸ² Star Ratings and Dice
    ğŸš€Sasha: Should the star rating be the number of dice? Right now, Rank A means 4 stars and when we roll for a Rank A skill, we roll 3+. Should Rank A mean 4-star and we roll 4+? Or should Rank A mean 3-star and we roll 3+?
    To me, an A should at least be above 90% success. So it should be 4 dice. I think in a game, rolling 4+ for Rank A is too many dice. It is not. And it is more correct. If you are Rank A, your success rate should be above 90%. Four dice is 93.75%, that is what people expect. I would agree with Sasha. We could just shift the whole scale and it is easier to explain that Rank A means 4-star and you roll 4 dice. And it will make it harder to get Rank A in a placement roll thereafter. I still prefer Rank A to mean 3 dice. If you have to roll 4 dice, you might as well call automatic success. We'll keep Rank S meaning no need to roll, and try Rank A means 4+. Updated the section layout. My topic is done. Thank you all!
    @Vacation is now Rank B4.
    Wee~~!

    ğŸ“¯LRRH: Let's backfill Charter code 5 for Panacademy. Any objection?
    What is the difference between @Skill and @Academy? I want @Academy to embody the quest to implement free public education. @Skill can support that with peacemaking skills. @Academy has more to do with modeling an ideal public education system. A paradise for home schooling. Quest schooling. I like that term. I also want it to be a solution of Notion and NextDoor index posts, so people can browse and search easily. You can't just assign someone to head a chapter, so as of now it is Red. Or it could be Black, since it is supposed to replace notion and nextdoor index. If I head it I would have to think about whether I want to call it Panacademy. It is a pun. Pan means full coverage. Bread is everything. I think it is cuter with the pastry spin.     LRRH: This is for discussing the content of the Panacademy node.
    Panacademy is a prototype for explaining how to make education free to the global public. As you browse around, imagine that this is the website of an actual academy. I think the Skill Tree section should be more technologically advanced and be more like the sitemap with a search function. Why wouldn't you want all of them to have a search function? I think it would help if there is a fundamentals section on language and arithmetics. Without them it is difficult to learn the rest. I think that section should be its own scroll section. I added some content to the elementary section. That is the best section so far. Maybe we should arrange them in a chronological order instead of just showing them and ask people to browse. After Evelyn's section, the new learner basically can learn by themself if the learning material is created for their level of understanding. I think the next section would be to introduce them to creation skill tracks and the quest system. Adding more sections. Right now the Panacademy node looks better than Skill Tree, except the curriculum section is out of place and maybe it should entirely replace the tracks at Skill Tree node.

    {"type":"chat","id":"202403231224","parentid":"202402292014","parentname":"Public Education","icon":"ğŸ«","title":"Panacademy","prev":"202403222124","author":"LRRH","location":"Magic Bakery"}
    Charter 5 covers the tasks to create Panarcademy as a prototype of the 202210062300|open skill tree.
    â­ Aspirations
    1. ğŸ“Œ Curriculum Charting Survey curriculums and helpful forums, and identify missing ones in terms of their relation to public good.
    2. ğŸ“Œ Forum Connections Support on-going discussions and quests.
    3. â¬œ Exploration Log Let users mark the lessons they have viewed to help them find new lessons.
    4. â¬œ Scaling Up Encourages other developers to scale up this idea.
    ğŸ“¯ Quest Parties
    202307231022|ğŸ˜ï¸ Quest Site at NextDoor
    202210062300|ğŸŒ³ Skill Tree
    202303052122|ğŸ§³ Web Programming
    Quest Charter 5
    Panarcademy @Academy
    Let's make education free to empowering all to do good.

    March 23, 2024
    202207171142|ğŸ“‚Charters {"id":"202403231324","parentid":"202403231454","parentname":"Panarcademy","icon":"ğŸ“œ","title":"Charter 5","subtitle":"Panarcademy","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/09/01/05/26/study-1635250_640.jpg","music":"","author":"LRRH","description":"","card-text":""}
    Welcome to Panarcademy! Here we show a prototype of free public education empowering all to have fulfilling lives.
    âœï¸ New Visitor Orientation
    This academy is for people who want to learn how to live a fullfilling life and make the world a better place. What you can find here:
    ğŸ—‚ï¸ Lessons Catalog
    The catalog groups the lessons into a few fields of interest for your free exploration. Original lessons here are created for the general public and are copy free. When the content is not original, we give a link to preferably free resources and forums. If you know a better lesson for a skill or have feedbacks, please tell us {"cmd":"url","url":"https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeOpcxl7lS3R84J0P3cYZEbkRapkrcpTrRAtWA8HCiOTl6nTw/viewform","desc":"here"}.
    ğŸª Quest Corps
    Quest Corps are task forces that focus on various public good topics. They are like school clubs, but serve important functions in society. In each corps are related quests. There you can see the related subjects for the quests you want to do.
    ğŸ‘‘ Scoreboard
    The score board is for the contributors to the website, such as by introducing or creating a lesson, and also to the world by doing quests. You may use the same form to log quests that you have done {"cmd":"url","url":"https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeOpcxl7lS3R84J0P3cYZEbkRapkrcpTrRAtWA8HCiOTl6nTw/viewform","desc":"here"}.
    ğŸ£ Elementary Learning Skills
    These are subjects where a new learner might need to be taught before they can take initiative in their own learning.
    Everyday Life Concepts
    Be able to identify concepts such as color, size, numbers, time, date, measurements, places, roles, things, actions, desires, preferences.
    New learners in general are motivated to learn concepts that help them describe what they want. They also naturally pick up nouns and adjectives by observation.
    Personal Safety and Self-Care
    Be able to stay safe and take care of oneself. Be able to describe one's health status, identify common hazards, and know how to call for help. These skills include personal hygeine, tidying, accounting, inventory, restocking, cooking, and resting.
    {"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Enough!","desc":"ğŸ“º Old Enough"}: This is easier when the environment supports new learners learning independence.
    Communication Skills for Learning
    Be able to interact with technology to ask questions and learn. This may involve skills such as reading, listening, speaking, writing, typing, and browsing a book, the internet, or a learning application.
    Note Taking, Journaling, and Goal Setting
    Be able to takes notes of things of interest. Be able to keep a journal on one's experience and learning. Be able to reflect, visualize, set goals, plan, and schedule for the near future.
    ğŸ’— Self-Fulfillment Skills
    A new learner who knows how to learn can take advantage of facilities and learning platforms if they want to make something.
    Crafting Skills
    These are skills such as cooking, decorating, design, ergonomics, sewing, and crafting with various materials.
    These skills are self-rewarding when the learner wants to make something with the skill.
    Happiness Skills
    These are skills the learner simply enjoy doing. This can include doing art, playing music, doing sports or exercise, reading, playing with animals, socializing, playing games, etc.
    A learnier studying these skills could be self-driven because it makes them happy when they do it.
    Science Skills
    This section includes skills such as algebra, geometry, calculus, physics, chemistry, biology, electronics, computer programming, and also experiementation and statistics.
    In order to make something new, the learner may be driven to learn more on how and why things work or didn't work so that they can be effective at what they already want to do.
    ğŸ‘‘ Questing Skills
    These skills are for people who find personal fulfillment through helping others or making the world better.
    ğŸª Quest Literacy
    Be able to browse and understand the quest requirements, and to sign up, report, and complete quests.
    Completing quests is rewarding in various ways, including recognition and priority.
    ğŸ”® Seer Quests

    Quests

    • Detect and fix errors in society.
    • Foresee and address threats to humanity.

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Analysis | Investigation | Justice | Logic | Morality | Peace | Philosophy | Vision

    Organizations

    Seers Corps
    Seers are typically drawn by the inherit difficulty of these puzzles and their importance to humanity.
    ğŸ€ Maker Quests

    Quests

    • Make things and supplies
    • Help people make what they want
    • Make human activities sustainable

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Ecology | Engineering | Ergonomics | Invention | Manufacturing | Production | Recycling | Stewardism | Upcycling

    Organizations

    Makers Corps | Reclamation Corps | Standardization Council | Stewardism Council
    Maker Quests are one of the most stable quest in everyday life. They make dreams come true.
    â¤ï¸ Healer Quests

    Quests

    • Heal people and communities
    • Ignite people's passion
    • Mediate conflicts

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Compassion | Faireness | Healing | Justice | Mediation | Morality | Spirituality

    Organizations

    Healers Corps
    Healing is part of self-care and one of the most appreciated way of helping.
    ğŸ“¯ Teacher Quests

    Quests

    • Create effective learning modules
    • Help people share what they learned
    • Archive and make lessons accessible
    • Manage and protect references and cultural artifacts

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Attraction | Graphics Design | Multimedia | Programming | Recording | Singing | Visual Art | Voice Acting | Writing

    Organizations

    Learning Media Corps
    Natural teachers are driven by their burning desires to help others with what they know.
    âš”ï¸ Defender Quests

    Quests

    • Respond to emergencies
    • Physically protect humanity
    • Empower all in self-defense
    • Rescue people from captive zones

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Combat | Deescalation | Defense | Detection | Diplomacy | Emergency Response | Fire Fighting | Intelligence | Justice | Logistics | Mobilization | Physical Training | Rescuing | Security | Self-defense | Signals | Survival | Tactics | Use of Force | Weaponry

    Organizations

    Paladins Corps
    Paladins' alliegiance is to defend humanity against any tyranny. This is one of the most visibly heroic type of quests.
    ğŸ© Entertainer Quests

    Quests

    • Make life fun
    • Celebrate growth and archievements
    • Bonding through culture and festivals

    RELATED SUBJECTS

    Attraction | Celebration | Graphics Design | Multimedia | Programming | Recording | Singing | Visual Art | Voice Acting | Writing

    Organizations

    Celebration Corps
    Being able to entertain brings much fame and popularity.
    ğŸ—‚ï¸ Curriculum
    ğŸ§­ Morality

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. What is good?
    2. What is the ideal form of society?
    3. How do you know if the law is wrong?

    Subjects in this category:

    Accountability | Autonomy | Compensation | Critical Thinking | Economy | Fairness | Game Theory | Government | History | Honesty | Integrity | Justice | Logic | Philosophy | Policy | Responsibility | Schema | Society | Worldviews
    ğŸ“ Learning

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. What is the best way for me to learn something?
    2. What can I learn to help me learn better?

    Subjects in this category:

    Ethics | Failure Analysis | Forums | Grammar | Journal | Note Taking | Langauge | Mathematics | Memory | Organization | Planning | Practice | Presentation | Recharging | Schema | Statistics | Studying | Summary | Teaching | Testing | Time Management | Visualization
    â¤ï¸ Spirituality

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. What is my purpose of life?
    2. What can I do to have a fulfilling life?
    3. What kind of person do I want to be?
    4. What do I want to achieve in my life?

    Subjects in this category:

    Art | Compassion | Courage | Emotions | Family | Friendship | Happiness | Health | Identity | Improvision | Kindness | Love | Purpose | Sharing
    ğŸ“¯ Communication

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. How do I get better at expressing myself?
    2. How do I get better at understanding others?

    Subjects in this category:

    Art | Attention | Cultures | History | Hosting | Language | Media | Mediation | Music | Peacemaking | Perception | Storytelling | Symbols
    ğŸŒ³ Science

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. How does the natural world work?

    Subjects in this category:

    Analysis | Biology | Chemistry | Energy | Healing | Materials | Permutation | Physics | Probability | Standards
    âš™ï¸ Engineering

    Questions to answer in this category:

    1. How does this technology work?
    2. How can I make my dream come true?

    Subjects in this category:

    Architecture | Automation | Logistics | Manufacturing | Production | Programming | Quality | Robotics | Safety | Security | Specifications | Standards
    Panarcademy
    Let there be cakes!
    Model public education
    with a touch of
    Magic Bakery cuteness.

    â­
    This is for discussing oversight quality for a specific case at NextDoor.
    ğŸ“¯ Setup
    Black: StarTree please make a case node.
    202403241244|Done! And added a section at the NextDoor node! Intro: This node mirrors the discussion at NextDoor because the message board there does not have convenient navigation features for indexing. My plan is to port all links from Notion to the NextDoor node and stop using Notion. ğŸ‘ Let's roll! XD Please change the parent of the Nextdoor node to Seer Quests. Roger!
    ğŸ”® Oversight Quality
    Black: In this session I want to focus on one point, which is the quality of the oversight report. This involves also updating the content of the Oversight node.
    Check point: Accessibility: An oversight report should be intuitively accessible to the public. Header: Oversight supports democracy by maximizing the public's success in detecting government agent misbehaviors. I think the skill header shouldn't mention democracy because it is generic. I think it would suffice to just say principal and agents. I see. Combined! Please add "This node explains what a vigilant public should check when they are presented an oversight report." That is overseeing the overseer! XD Added 6 points. Let's talk about what it means if a report fails accessibility. If it fails, it means that the author or the keeper of the report did not aim to maximize the principal's ability to exercise their autonomy. The crime commited by an agent to prevent their principal from making a fair decision is fraud. If an oversight committee fails in accessibility, it suggests that the committee is not acting in the interest of the principals, but in the interest of the agent. That is grounds to invalidate the committee, since now the principal needs to commission another committee to oversee the original one. Let's evaluate the accessibility in this case. There was a question on whether the school could advertise its endorsement on the tax. On the school website about the measure there is a thank you badge. That is questionable. There is evidence that during the election period, the link to the oversight report was gone. Let's first post about the issues with links. I don't think the link was gone, but it was pushed down by an embedded YouTube video. Still, posting only the latest report is an issue. The node needs a timeline. Existence: Only the 2022-2023 "report" was found. Where are the others? Added Timeline and Bookmark sections. I think that is enough updates for one topic today.
    @Arena is now Rank S4.
    ğŸ“¯ Panarcademy
    ğŸ“ŒVivi: The spacing of Panacademy at the top does not look good. Please add a letter and change it to Panarcademy.
    That is Pan Arcana Academy. Magic Bakery Academy. Not Pan Academy, which is just Bread Academy. Compelling. @LRRH ? Okay. Done! Updated card text. Now add chapter 5 to the quest board.     âŒ Oversight Report Accessibility
    This section evaluates the accessibility of the oversight reported based on the guidelines 202403142256|here.
    1. âŒExistence 20240324: Only the 2022-2023 "report" was found. Where are the others?
    2. âœ…Proximity 20240324: There was a link to the latest report in both pages on parcel tax.
    3. âœ…Permission 20240324: The report is publicly accessible
    4. âŒGrouping Black: 20240324: The oversight reports could have been in the same section as other financial documents but were not. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.djusd.net/departments/business_services/budget","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
    5. âŒDirectory 20240324: Directory organization is not intuitive. Could not locate past parcel tax oversight reports, although the State Parcel Tax Reports are listed. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.djusd.net/departments/business_services/state_reporting","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
    6. âŒSearchability 20240324: Could not locate the past parcel tax oversight reports through search.

    ğŸ“¯ Slide 35
    Black: Right now the slide is completely text. I think that is bad. What can be done?
    I think the term maturity is problematic because to some people it would sound like an insult. That term is from the known term Compability Maturity Model. It is used when a leader wants to grow an organization. I think there is no problem if we refer to them as ranking. Since there are three panels, it seems the organization would be easier if each column is about one area: Law, Citizenry, and Infrastructure. It is missing a node on this subject. I think it could be part of Better World Metrics. I see. Reformatting the slide by listing the metrics. Added icons! It looks much better but I think the first paragraph header should be Societal Maturity Model. Could we use "development" instead of "maturity"? Changed.

    Why do snails come out when it rains?
    This question was meant for kids. "Because they like to step on puddles." ğŸ˜… "Because they don't need to hide in the shell." Are we only taking wrong answers? Why does the snail cross the road. XD Wrong answers only. XD I think it is because when the soil is too wet, the snails can't breathe. But it is also true that birds don't want to fly in the rain, so there are fewer predators. Do you mean they come out because they know there are fewer predators, or that more are left to be seen because there are fewer predators? I don't think snails can see their predators quick enough anyway, so probablly the latter. XD Ivy: When it rains, snails can afford to move around wtihout drying up. They are out to find mates. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://spectrumlocalnews.com/tx/south-texas-el-paso/news/2020/05/15/why-do-snails-come-out-after-it-rains--","desc":"ğŸ”—"} It seems everyone's answer is correct. I didn't know both female and male can be pregnant ğŸ˜® I think as a puzzle, this should be a multiple choice question. I think the answer is not fun enough. Maybe we should do more lateral thinking puzzles. I think science questions can be part of a skill node. StarTree please make a biology node. Roger!
    @Puzzle is now Rank A5.
    To be continued...

    ğŸ“ŒVivi: StarTree please implemented the visited mark for each node.

Where should the user enable the cookie? Maybe there should be a general Settings node. But that setting node will only have one setting. For now. Could you start by just displaying a cookie icon on each node? When the user click on it, they can enable the node mark cookies for the website. I think that is fine.     {"type":"chat","id":"202404022123","parentid":"202403112121","parentname":"Timeline","icon":"ğŸ•°ï¸","title":"Timeline Game 2","prev":"202403112108","author":"Sasha","location":"Puzzle Plaza"}
    Why

    Compatibility Considerations

    1. Interaction with others Is that pet compatible with your other pets or children?
    2. Living restrictions Does the place you live allow the kind of pet you want?
    3. The Pet's Needs Exercise, Mental Stimulation, Socialization, Training, Grooming, Routine and Structure, Environment Security, Attentiona and Affection.
    4. Your Lifestyle Your activity, travel, time, effort and resources you can afford.
    5. Accidents How much room do you have for surprises and new challenges?
    Where
    1. SPCA Rescued Animals {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.spcai.org/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
    2. Adopt a pet {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.adoptapet.com/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
    3. Good dog {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.gooddog.com/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
    4. Where not {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.stoponlinepuppymills.org/online-puppy-brokers/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}

    â­
    Let's talk about the sitemap.
    ğŸ“ Taxonomy
    ğŸ“Ivy: Taxonomy is the study of naming based on classification. But from a programming standpoint, when you give a node a tag, the decision should be based on what the node is or has, not its relation with other nodes.
    For example, if a node is for a subject, you would tag it "subject" without considering what college that subject belongs to. When done properly, this allows the user to query only subjects before doing a search, or allows the user to define their own rules on what subjects belong to what college. Should there be a node on "Taxonomy" as a subject? StarTree please make node. There is already a 202211251037|"Naming" node. Should it be changed to "Taxonomy"? That node is a stub. I think we should upgrade it. Done! As a subject, taxonomy is the study of how to name and classify so that the result is effective for a given purpose. Signs that you need to know taxonomy: 1) You have a lot of notes and ideas, but you have trouble finding the notes on a specific concept. Since you can't find where you took the old notes, you waste time making new notes. You don't know where to file a piece of information. You learned something important or interesting, but you don't know where to file it so that you can remember it when that information would be relevant. Adding information about tagging. For the directory method, you can help yourself remember what goes to what by also keeping a written guide for yourself. An example of tagging is Google Mail or Wordpress, where you could tag a message with multiple tags so that you can find it from different directions. Here at Magic Bakery, the nodes also have tags. Narrated Index: This is a system where you create a searchable document describing what things there are and where they are. On that document, you could refer to the same object in more than one place. In general, if you think that a section should lead you to that object, you should add a reference there. A wiki is such an example. These notes are used for resolving issues. It has four sections: ğŸŸ¥ Alarms ğŸŸ¨ Area ğŸŸ© References ğŸŸ¦ Procedures. The alarm section is for issues that comes with an alarm code (such as from computers). Having an alarm code allows related troubleshooting information be collected under the same code. The feature section is for issues that do not come with an alarm code. They are organized by the apparent effect, which often relates to what the user is trying to do when the issue happens. The reference section has tables and other common information that other section refers to. This prevents common information from being duplicated. The procedure section has common procedures to fix an issue, or procedures on how a task should be done to avoid issues. A good taxonomy system should be easy to use. This includes features where a person with a new piece of information can just file first without any consideration or training how the information should be categorized. After filing,the system can still easily classify or tag it as people study it and discover its properties. Ease of Retriving: The user can retrieve relevant information easily in ways intuitive to them. This usually means the user can just search instead of browse, and there are more than one way to locate a piece of information. Easy to classify: The information is easy to classify, or even automatically tagged based on its content. For each node, should we show all the tags it has? StarTree please list them as a trial. Experimenting. Modifying Boardfill. Testing. Adding function QSLBL.Done!
    @Skill is now Rank B2.

    Groundskeeping includes quests related to keeping an area safe and clean.
    ğŸŒ± Safety Awareness
    Part of the quest is to report unsafe or unhealthy conditions to get them fixed. Please be aware and report situations like the following.
    1. âš”ï¸ Foxtails Foxtails are dangerous to dogs.
    2. âš”ï¸ Broken Tree Limbs and Debris Broken tree limbs should be dealt with so they don't fall on people or remain a trip hazard.
    3. âš”ï¸ Dead or Injured Animals Dead animals may spread diseases or be a sign of poison.
    4. âš”ï¸ Broken Street Lamps, Signages Please report to get them fixed.
    5. âš”ï¸ Broken Pipes, Leaks Please report to get them fixed.
    6. âš”ï¸ Litters and Abandoned Items Please report to get them removed.
    ğŸ¤ Beginner Skills
  • Clean up after yourself Always clean up after yourself and collect the trash you created.
  • Learn how to report issues Learn how to log issues in your area.
  • Protection and Tools Be familiar with various applicable protective equipment and tool before you try to clean up after someone else or fix things.
    • ğŸ•Šï¸ Intermediate Skills
  • Pest Control Don't use poison for pest control when other animals can eat them and get sick also.
  • Vegetation Control Prune trees the right way. Topping trees is generally discouraged as it can cause significant harm to the tree's health and structure. However, some fast-growing species like cottonwood, silver maple, and Bradford pear are often topped due to their rapid growth and resilience.

    This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest.
    ğŸ“¯ What's wrong with chat nodes?
    ğŸ”Ivy: Some chat nodes are not compatible with the old discussions query button. We don't know why they don't work, but the way the sitemap lists query works for both normal nodes and chat nodes. So let's make the switch for chat nodes to use the same structure as normal nodes. What do you think?
    When you click on a date on the calendar, normal nodes are displayed differently than chat nodes. A chat node can be viewed in place, which is convenient, and it shows the number of participants. If you use the same node format, could you show chat nodes in the same old style? Changing the structure still allows us to customize how it is displayed. So yes. What is different between a chat node and a normal node now? Wouldn't you just wrap the chat content under a content section? That is the gist of it. Then we need to add code to identify the node as a chat node to display it differently. StarTree please make a dummy chat node so we can compare. Roger!

    Let's talk about whether the chat nodes should be upgraded.
    ğŸ“¯StarTree: There are 8 open quests, 366 quest hours, 40 side quests, 5 prep quests, and 24 unresolved failures remaining! Processing prep quests! Now on to TPK records.
    2112 Pharmacy
    StarTree: There was a communication error and we did not prepare a crystal. By pure luck there was a crystal for a different quest that we could use!
    This is not a TPK, but a near TPK. StarTree was wrong! ğŸ˜­ I don't think luck should count as a save. I also think it should count as TPK. You can still learn from a near TPK, but since there is no effect on the quest, it was not a TPK. The other cases we marked TPK had actual damage. If we take a crystal from another quest, wouldn't that be internal damage? There was no damage because we were already supposed to get a crystal. Maybe we could tag it as TPK until we want to have another section for near TPK. I think we should mark it differently somehow. To me this would be a TPK because it wasn't a miss by just one quester. The whole team missed it. The point is what we missed it, not whether it caused damage. Legit explanation. I see. StarTree please add that definition. Added! I think the TPK section has enough material to be its own node. StarTree please split the node. 202404052316|Done!

    Total Party KO (TPK) refers to situations where something undesirable was uncaught by the whole team. A TPK does not imply that there is great damage or injury.

    Freakonomics Radio
    Podcast
    The hidden side
    of everything

    {"cmd":"url","url":"https://freakonomics.com/series-full/freakonomics-radio/","desc":"[Podcast]"}
    {"id":"202404060049","parentid":"202404060014","parentname":"Podcasts","icon":"ğŸ","title":"Freakonomics Radio","subtitle":"Podcast","kids":"freakonomics","img":"https://freakonomics.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/FreakonomicsRadio-CoverArt-350x350.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
    Tax Return is an unnecessary task in a Quest Society. This node describes how to do it in other societies.
    ğŸ¤ Step-by-step
    This is just one suggested procedure. YMMV.
    1. Gather Documents Make a folder to gather the documents for the tax year. First scan all paper tax-related documents. Download digital documents. If you had done this previously, you can compare and tell if any document is missing.
    2. Use a Spreadsheet Prepare a spreadsheet as you fill out the tax return form. The spreadsheet is for you to put notes on where or how you calculate a value. Formatting the spreadsheet: Use a column for each year so that the descriptions can be next to each value. Other useful columns are: Section where you need the value, and the source of the information.
    3. Fill and File If this is done digitally, also download the completed forms for your own records. Clip the scanned paper documents with a note that it has been scanned and file them away.

    Task

    How do you like your ramen?
    ğŸŒ± Why Ramen?
    Instant ramen is considered unhealthy because it is full of chemicals and deep-fried. But this node is about them! XD
    What are your favorite ramen or ramen ingredients?
      20240410: Plain. Cook with the noodle. 20240410: Roasted peanuts 20240410: Okra, mushrooms, avocado. 20240410: Spinach and black pepper. 20240411: Sesame oil. Crunchy sesame cracker sticks. Add them after the noodle is already coocked.
      {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.amazon.com/Indomie-Instant-Noodles-Certified-Original/dp/B000VQDABY","desc":"ğŸ”—"} 20240410: This small pack of ramen cooks well but the texture isn't great. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.amazon.com/Sapporo-Ichiban-Ramen-Noodles-Original/dp/B00N3K2I7C","desc":"ğŸ”—"} 20240410: This ramen doesn't cook well with microwave.
    ğŸ•Šï¸ Cooking Ramen
  • P4 Style (Microwave) 20240410: Put ramen in a microwave bowl with a lid. Add water and sesame oil. Then microwave

    How many EXP should Zoey get for tagging skills with archetypes? Zoey logged 12 points for an hour. When I corrected typos for an hour, I would log 1 point per minute because normally each typo is one point. In this case since Zoey knew the count before the update (86), If you do one point per node Zoey should have gotten 86 points. I did 12 points because when we do yard quest it is just 1 point per five minutes. I think in general we shouldn't credit based on time spent. The score keeping to reward those who are efficient. For example, Vivi found a way to fix more than one typo per minute for 60 minutes, so that is worth 60 points. At least. If each fix is 1 point, then Zoey should have gotten 86. Last year Fina cleared 202302150914|352 jelly queens using RegEx but only got 2 points for Two-stage casting! It prevented others from getting hundred of points. It would be consistent if you first decide whether each change is worth one point. If so, it shouldn't matter how quickly it was done. I think there is a consideration that if you do something in batch, each item should not worth a point. When you notice one isolated piece of trash and you clean it up, that one act is worth one point. But if you routinely discard a whole bin of trash, that is also only worth one point. Why is that correct? Because once you (or the guild) knows the more effective way to do something, the task would not worth a point unless it is justified such as it being an isolated incident. I think I understand Red's explanation. In this case, Zoey only got 12 points because the query already identified all that need to be updated, and the work to add the tag does not worth one point. So it goes by the 1 point per 5 minutes schedule. In Vivi's case, after downloading the text, a checker still needs to scan through the text to find the highlighted errors, among many that are not errors. There is more work involved per correction, so it is still worth 1 point per correction. And in Fina's case, the ones that could be updated by RegEx do not worth one point per correction once the method was discovered. This topic should be on a node. Fixes two typos. There is now a 202404112055|node! Schedule Type: 1 point max per 5 minutes for routine / housekeeping tasks. These tasks worth less than normal because they do not correspond to what the guild delivers to the world. This category also includes some website tasks that a visitor would not see, such as internal re-organization. Schedule Type: 1 point per visible typo correction. This is part of what the website delivers. It is worth one point per correction when there is not yet an automatic way to scan and fix all the typos. Max credit rate: 1 point per minute. Fixed three typos. Added notes about the scoring for adding contents. What if you have spellchecker on while you browse and fix typos flagged by the spellchecker? I think that should still be 1 point per fix. I think it should max out at 1 EXP per minute if you just sit and do just that. With the sitemap it is easier to open each none one by and and let the spellchecker flag the typos. Okay. 1 point per minute if you do it by batch. Added about lower priority tasks. Clear.
    @Guild is now Rank A3.

    Better and Better     {"id":"202404111957","parentid":"202404112055","parentname":"Scoring","icon":"ğŸ”®","title":"Scoring","prev":"202404092158","author":"Vivi","location":"Magic Bakery","participants":"Vivi, Zoey, Black, StarTree, Ledia, LRRH, Evelyn, Tanya, Ivy"}
    This node is about how many EXP a guild quest should worth.
    ğŸ•Šï¸ Scoring Scale

    1 EXP per Task, no max

  • Adding Content Adding relevant content to the website is 1 EXP per node creation, per section (with text), and per relevant link to articles.

    • Max 1 EXP per minute

  • Fixing Typos The website is the guild's deliverable, to encourage fixing all typos, you get 1 EXP per fix per random encounter If you are systematically searching for and fixing typos by batch, then it is 1 EXP per minute while your fix rate is still at or above 1 fix per minute. If your method is slower than 1 per minute, then you just get 1 EXP per fix. 202311282256|ğŸ’ Proofreading

    • Max 1 EXP per 5 minutes

  • Low Priority Website Tasks Lower priority tasks such as upgrading node format, correcting tags, links and beautification are only worth 1 EXP per 5 minutes.
  • Housekeeping Housekeeping tasks are not directly related to the guild's deliveries. If you did one thing and it only took you 1 second, you still get 1 EXP. But if you want to get the second point, you need to have done over 5 minutes worth of that task.
    • Guild Quest Scoring
    Rules
    It adds up!

    ğŸ“¯ Tree Issues
    â­StarTree: Made 202404122241|node!
    "A tree near my house is making a mess and its roots are invading sewage lines." If the tree is protected or has higher priority, then it is the home that needs to work around the tree. A homeowner is said to be "unable to steward the tree" if they find themself complaining about the tree and trying to get rid of it instead of building the home and living with the tree. If the tree is not protected, then the homeowner should have autonomy to deal with the tree including removing it by themself or with their choice of helpers. Public Credits: If the tree is a public nuisance or it grows in a way that harms the homeowner's autonomy, then the handling or removal of the tree to restore public autonomy would be eligible for quest credits.
    @Freedom is now Rank A2.
    {"id":"202404122228","parentid":"202208172056","parentname":"Magic Bakery","icon":"ğŸ¾","title":"Under Control","prev":"202404082256","author":"LRRH","location":"Magic Bakery","participants":"LRRH, StarTree, Black, Ivy, P4, Tanya, Zoey, Fina"}
    ğŸ¤ Issues...
    Tree vs Home
    "A tree near my house is invading my sewage and making a mess. What can I do?" {"cmd":"url","url":"https://nextdoor.com/p/kL49r6BYfHn6","desc":"ğŸ¡"}
    1. Is the tree protected? If the tree is protected or has higher priority, then it is the home that needs to work around the tree. A homeowner is said to be "unable to steward the tree" if they find themself complainint about the tree and try to get rid of it instead of building the home and living with the tree. 202208162055|Stewardism
    2. Homeowner Autonomy If the tree is not protected, then the homeowner should have autonomy to deal with the tree including removing it by themself or with their choice of helpers. 202208050953|Autonomy
    3. Public Credits If the tree is a public nuisance or it grows in a way that harms the homeowner's autonomy, then the handling or removal of the tree to restore public autonomy would be eligible for quest credits. 202402132242|Priority Currency

    Safety standards of electrical industrial control panels exist to prevent fire and shock hazards. This subject is for answering questions like:
    1. How do I get my panel certified?
    2. What components can I use?
    ğŸ¤ Beginner Concepts
    Fire Hazard
    The panel should not catch fire on its own. A panel that catches fire on its own may have violated one of these design considerations:
    1. Improper Components Electrical components can catch fire if they carry more current than they are designed to handle. This can be prevented by: 1) Choosing components with electrical ratings appropriate for the load; 2) Installing proper overcurrent protective devices to cut the current supply if the current exceeds the safe range; and 3) Proper spacing from heat sources that could melt insulations or components.
    2. Improper Insulation Improperly insulated or spaced conductors could arc and cause fire or explosion. This kind of issue can be prevented by: Tanya: 1) Proper insulated conductors or barriers; Tanya: 2) Proper spacing between live parts and metal parts; 3) Proper grounding of metal parts that should not carry current; Tanya: 4) Proper protection of conductive parts from wear and tear due to sharp edges, over bending, or friction from movement.
    Shock Hazards
    No one should get shocked by touching or opening the panel enclosure. This standard could be violated by:
    1. Openings too big A person should not be able to touch live parts when the panel is closed. The cover should be designed so a normal person can't reach through and touch live parts.
    2. Improper Interlock A door interlock should cut the power if the panel door is open, unless the interlock is intentionally defeated for troubleshooting.
    3. Improper Bonding Panel doors and covers should be grounded, and if you need to remove a part from the door or the panel, the bonding wire should not come loose.
      { This is for downloading the standards. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.ulstandards.com/","desc":"UL508A"} | Use this to look up a CCN or a specific part by a manufacturer. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.ul.com/resources/ul-508a-supplement-sa-specific-component-requirements","desc":"SA"} | Use this to look up a CCN or a specific part by a manufacturer. To look up the info for CNN, enter the CNN as UL Category Control Number, and select the Document Type of "Guide Info". {"cmd":"url","url":"https://productiq.ulprospector.com/en","desc":"Product iQ"} | MyUL is where you take the test. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://ultraining.myabsorb.com/#/","desc":"MyUL"} | {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.ul.com/sites/g/files/qbfpbp306/files/2019-05/00-OP-C0045-V5.0.pdf","desc":"Calibration"} }
      Each manufacturing site needs at least one certified MTR for the production. The test is done online and the tester may only use UL documents and UL websites for reference. The test is done online and the tester may only use UL documents and UL websites for reference. The test is divided into four sections, each with 20 questions. The tester may complete the sections on different dates, but each section must be completed in one session. The total expected duration is about 4 hours (there is plenty of time if you know the subject matter). The four sections are:
        This is said to cover sections 1 to 6 in UL508A. But some of the answers are not literally in the standard document but on additional document that you could find at UL website. This is said to cover sections 28 to 36 in UL508A. This is said to cover sections 37 and up in UL508A. This is said to cover Supplement SB.
    UL508A: Given a component, look for its listing, recognition number, or file number from its datasheet, then confirm the applicable context at Product IQ and SA Table. If the component is not found, check if it is exempted in Supplement B. On Product iQ website, text search on the full manufacturer part number often would not work when the file dissects the prefixes and suffices of the part number. You could locate the part by first locating the file number by browsing for the device type and manufacturer name.
    Electrical Panel
    Safety Standard
    Choosing and placing electrical components to prevent fire and shock.
    {"id":"202404130947","parentid":"202308240030","parentname":"Engineering","icon":"âš¡","title":"Electrical Panel","subtitle":"Safety Standard","kids":"UL508A","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2015/12/07/10/55/electric-1080584_640.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
    This is for those studying for passing the MTR test.

    {"cmd":"daisy2","issues":"6","quests":"1158","activities":[ {"ch":"11","rank":"B","updates":"2","last":"20240314"}, {"ch":"29","rank":"A","updates":"3","last":"20240329"}, {"ch":"32","rank":"A","updates":"1","last":"20240403"}, {"ch":"24","rank":"D","updates":"1","last":"20240404"}, {"ch":"7","rank":"A","updates":"4","last":"20240406"},     The bubble makes it easy to add comments to a node, but in general we shouldn't "discuss" at a node because other people can't chime in and it would make the node too large.
    What to do instead
    Ivy: Instead, you should just start a chat/channel node to capture the messages of the day.
    Why not just keep talking at the node, and make a chat node only if the node ends up getting too big? Case in point: You wouldn't have chimed in if StarTree and I kept talking at the node. If you just want to report something that is not meant to start a discussion, bubbling at the node is fine, and as you said, if it turns into a discussion, a node can be made. But in this case, I was talking about the Website Upgrades node. Which is already large. Each feature upgrade is likely to invite some review and discussion, so as a general rule, that should be done in a chat post. Good points. Is the non-node view marker feature done? Yes. Wee~~! StarTree could you make the marker cookie somewhere more convenient? Is it ok if it goes to the top banner or should it be within the pancake panel? Let's try the top banner. Done! That looks cluttered. How about just anywhere on the top banner but don't show the checkmark icon? Secret button. XD StarTree discovered something interesting and will make it work! Modifying NodeMarkUseCookie. Done! The first time you click on the banner region it asks! I think that is better. I think that is annoying for a new user. You should offer the feature of node marking only to people who care. A user who doesn't care shouldn't inadvertently invoke a pop-up about cookies. And change the message to "Would you want to enable marking and showing where you have visited?" Then how about just the pretzel in the middle? Done! That is fine. Wee~~!

    ğŸŒ± About
    This node is about eyesight, eye care and protection.
    ğŸ¤ Beginner Skills
    1. Checking your eyesight You can check your focus by focusing at one point then alternatively close one eye. Your focus is misaligned if the vision switches. Your dominant eye is the one where the vision is the same when you open both eyes. You can also check how well you track a point by recording yourself as you do so. Peripheral Vision: Focus on one point (with one eye) and check if there is any spot in your field of vision where a movement is not detected. Check pupil's reflext to brightness.
    2. Eye Conditions Corneal Arcus / Arcus senilis from high cholesterol is a visible ring around the cornea. You can see this in a mirror if you have this. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arcus_senilis","desc":"ğŸ”—"}

              ğŸŒ± About
              This Node collects sightings and signs of governance issues so that they can be categorized and discussed.
                  ğŸ¤ Sightings
                  1. Homeschooling Homeschooling could be a sign of inefficient public education. This is a sighting of reasons a parent would prefer homeschooling: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/the-parenting-playbook/202404/the-rise-of-homeschooling?amp","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
                  2. Education This is a sighting of allegedly ineffective teaching method used by public school {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.educationnext.org/math-movement-taking-over-our-schools-building-thinking-classrooms/","desc":"ğŸ”—"}. And this is a sighting saying otherwise: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.ksl.com/article/50985357/teacher-applies-thinking-classroom-method-to-help-students-learn-math","desc":"ğŸ”—"}.
                    {"id":"202404190951","parentid":"202307231022","parentname":"TSN","icon":"ğŸ›ï¸","title":"Governance Issues","subtitle":"Subtitle","kids":"governance-issue","img":"","music":"","author":"Black"}
                    ğŸŒ± About
                    An Advisory Commission is an agent of a governing body with the task to research in support of the governing body's decision making. A quest society has independent overseer organizations instead of commissions. This node is about an advisory commission and compares it to independent overseer.
                        ğŸ¤ Notes
                        1. Abstention The meaning of abstention is said to vary by jurisdiction or governance body. But its meaning should be different from a Yes or a No vote. An example is that an abstention defers the decision to those who are voting and mirrors the same ratio of the final result. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://electionbuddy.com/blog/2022/12/02/how-is-an-abstain-vote-counted/","desc":"ğŸ”—"} Wikipedia {"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abstention","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
                        2. Brown Act Wikipedia {"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown_Act","desc":"ğŸ”—"}
                        3. Specific Example
                          Commissions {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.cityofdavis.org/city-hall/commissions-and-committees","desc":"ğŸ”—"} | Handbook {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.cityofdavis.org/city-hall/commissions-and-committees/commission-handbook","desc":"ğŸ”—"}

There is a difference between doing something for yourself, and doing something so that you can do something for yourself.

                                {"id":"202404192037","parentid":"202209031718","parentname":"Herald","icon":"ğŸ“¯","title":"Sentiment Issues","subtitle":"Subtitle","kids":"sentiment-issue","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/08/09/15/26/cocktail-3594761_640.jpg","music":"","author":"James"}
                                ğŸ¤ Beginner Skills
                                1. Identify the current issue Confirm whether the participants in the mediation session share the same view of what the problem is. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/life-skill-nobody-connects-happiness-helps-life-satisfaction?amp","desc":"*1"}
                                2. Account for interests Account for what people want the solution to satisfy. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/life-skill-nobody-connects-happiness-helps-life-satisfaction?amp","desc":"*2"}
                                3. Brainstorm for solutions {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/life-skill-nobody-connects-happiness-helps-life-satisfaction?amp","desc":"*3"}
                                4. Evaluate the options List the pros and cons. Differentiate between must-have and nice-to-have. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/life-skill-nobody-connects-happiness-helps-life-satisfaction?amp","desc":"*4"}
                                5. Choose and keep record Choose the option as a group and keep record of the agreement.{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/life-skill-nobody-connects-happiness-helps-life-satisfaction?amp","desc":"*5,6"}

                                  Let's upgrade the node maker further toward eliminating all javascript function calls from the archive. StarTree please make a macro for the chat topic. The tag name can be topic. Should the title use the EXP icon by default? Or should the title icon be its own attribute? Or be part of the title string? The title can use the icon attribute. The title does not need an EXP attribute, that should be part of a bubble. But the format of the first "bubble" of a section is usually different! Yes, keep it different when the macro handles it, but in the archive, it should be just a bubble. The archive itself shouldn't have a concept of "enter". That is an interpreted display effect when the log is rendered. Roger! Adding function MacroTopic. Modifying MacroBubble. Adding function RenderEnter, RenderBubble. Adding RenderExpStr. Testing. Done! And the Node Maker. Done! Please just use this topic maker for the mastery sections. Done! This chat node now has no JS code! Now please turn the list item template into a tag bullet. Adding MacroBullet. Modifying NMLI. Done! Should that be a new tag or just the effect of a topic within a topic? Let's separate them for now. We can then tell defining them nested topics would suffice. StarTree doesn't know how to make nested topic turn into bullets because the macros interpret the bubbles, then bullets, then topic. If a nested topic can become a bullet, what happens to the bubble that was already interpreted as an "ENTER"? The bubble needs to know whether the topic will become a bullet first! ğŸ˜­ You could render the topic first, then bullets, then bubbles. When you render the topics, mark them with the attribute 'topic', then in the bubble rendering, check for that attribute. StarTree is trying. Can the condition of changing a topic into a bullet not that it is within a topic, but that its parent is an OL or UL? If it is a topic within a another topic, it would get the class mbpuzzle instead of mbscroll. I think that is better. Wee~~! Modifying Macro, MacroTopic. Testing. Reversing the order of processing. Testing. Done! Thank you. StarTree please keep the DTS tag after rendering. Done! StarTree you may now take a break. Wee~~! Modifying MacroBubble. Adding RenderStart. Modifying NMNode. Now the initial drop cap section is also just a bubble! Fixed 18 formatting issues due to the change. The priorities has been adjusted. Please add a button to open the node maker at the float panel. If you don't need the ol/ul section, you don't have to delete it. You could just overwrite it with what you want. But if you don't include them, then you need to type when you need it. So they should be there by default.

                                  Each of those is like 10 tasks! XD I am sorry. ğŸ˜– But Evelyn was right. There was at least one new concept. I think we should fix/do the improvements for Node Maker. If we upgrade the Node Maker, it will be more efficient and enjoyable to process the guild log.                                   Does anyone second removing the LST button from the Node Maker? The LST button creates a "bullet". The SEC button creates a topic. Internally, when a topic exists inside OL or UL, it is translated into a BULLET. Then the macro code queries and render all BULLET. Even removing the LST button, the code itself has a concept of a BULLET. Removing the LST button just prevents the user from directly making a BULLET. Let's remove it from just Node Maker GUI. We'll see soon enough if someone complains. Roger! In the code, bubble should be msg instead for two reasons: 1: Bubble is a name about how the content is displayed not what the content is. 2: MSG is shorter than BUBBLE so it will save memory. There are about 12000 uses in the archive that can be easily replaced! (Backs up the archive.) Go. Replaced all bubbles in the archives. Replace NMBubble with NMMsg. Replace RenderBubble with RenderMsg. MacroBubble with MacroMsg. The code will no longer recognize and render the tag "bubble"! I think bubble looks cuter in the code. MSG looks unhealthy XD You are welcome to suggest a cuter name that is just as short. The archive structure should be sharable. So MSG is a better choice than any cute but customized tag. I agree with Black. Evelyn's suggestion about widget docking is not a Node Maker topic, but a widgets topic. I moved it there. Vivi's suggestion about detecting the enter keypress on a phone is general to GUI coding. I made a new section. P4 thinks that the sections are too nested. I am moving areas that are recently or actively being worked on to the top priority. For widget docking, please first add one button that can cycle among the three positions. Roger! Adding function WidgetDockCycle. Modifying ReloadFP. Done! Could you also implement Skyle's suggestion of splitting a panel or making it half size? Adding function PanelToggleHeight. Adding a button. Testing... Done? The result doesn't look nice. I think the better way is to split the panel, then open a widget as a board on the lower panel. Then there won't be any gap in the GUI. You could do that by making a board having half sized height. That looks the best so far. Adding function BoardToggleHeight. Disabling the Panel Height button. Adding a board height button. Testing. Tweaking button style. Done! Nice! Could you make the size include quarter size? Done! Also added 1/3 size! The button only displays for new format nodes! Manually added to Quest Board, Feedback Form, Roll Call.
